Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Company:




ExsolvÃ¦ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.

Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:




Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.
BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.
Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.
Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data.




We provide a collaborative ecosystem for a new generation of pluri-disciplinary engineers who are eager to broaden their understanding of challenges across the data flow.




As a Solver in Data Science at ExsolvÃ¦, you will be responsible for providing data-driven solutions to our clients' challenges in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing, ...




Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing complex data sets and extracting insights to inform decision making using software such as Python, R, and SQL.
Designing and implementing data-driven solutions using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Collaborating with clients to understand their needs and challenges, and providing recommendations.
Communicating findings and recommendations to clients in a clear and concise manner.
Continuously learning and staying up-to-date with the latest developments in the field of Data Science.
Mentoring junior team members and contributing to the development of the Data Science team.







Key Requirements:




A Master's or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong experience in data analysis and machine learning techniques.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proactive and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
A strong desire to learn and stay up-to-date with the latest developments in Data Science.
Fluent in English (Mandatory).
Fluency in Flemish and/or French (Mandatory).







Additional Preferred Qualifications:




Programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Data visualization tools such as Tableau and Matplotlib.
Machine learning libraries and frameworks such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
Cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, and Azure.
Data storage and management systems such as Hadoop, Spark, and NoSQL databases.
Collaboration and project management tools such as Jupyter and GitHub.







Advantages of the Position:




Long Term Contract (CDI)
The opportunity to work on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects in industries such as banking, insurance, and pharmaceutical manufacturing.
A collaborative and supportive work environment.
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
Attractive salary and benefits package.
The chance to be part of a meaningful project from the start.

Title: Data Scientist - AI/NLP/ML - 4803
Description:
CV Submission until 26.07.2024

Service delivery: Near Site, Belgium - The services shall be performed remotely in Near-site location allowing to reach the Commission premises in Brussels within 2 hours.

VASS, in partnership with the European Commission, is currently seeking an Data Scientist - AI/ML/NLP to work for the European Commission in Belgium

DESCRIPTION OF THE TASKS


Development and maintenance of software applications in the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP), Machine Learning (ML) and/or Artificial Intelligence (AI);
Training of custom machine learning / deep learning models based on structured and unstructured data;
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques;
Studies and developments aiming at improving the quality of machine translation (MT) engines for each installed language pair, addressing the specific needs of customers of the service concerning MT quality and contributing to a general strategy for the systematic evaluation and long-term improvement of MT quality;
Interact with data stewards and other IT stakeholders to define the data rules;
Define data controls and implement actions to ensure data quality and integrity;
Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance;
Data mining using state-of-the-art methods;
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis;
Design the IT architecture for solitons in the NLP / ML / AI fields, and coordinate its implementation considering master- and meta-data management concepts;
Analyse data architecture for consistency, completeness, accuracy and reasonableness;
Contributing for the analysis of data management vision, strategy and policy and derive the IT requirements; Contributing to the design of the IT architecture considering master- and meta-data management concepts; Elaboration of test programs;
Writing of technical documentation;
Assistance with deployment and configuration of the system;
Participation in meetings with the contracting authority, project teams and user groups.


JOB REQUIREMENTS


Master's Degree in Computer Science or related field
Extensive hands-on experience with the design and implementation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python (programming in R is considered an asset).
Very good experience with libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, Hugging Face, PyTorch, scikit-learn, or Keras.
Very good knowledge with using cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for designing/implementing scalable AI/ML/RAG/etc. solutions.
Extensive hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
Good knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory Statistics, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Good knowledge of data pre-processing and analysis techniques.
Good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly.
Good experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Good experience of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Experience in training deep learning models.
Good knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Extensive experience with model evaluation and validation techniques.
Extensive experience with deploying ML models to production.
Good knowledge of potential bias and fairness issues in AI systems.
Knowledge of the applicable data privacy regulations (GDPR) and compliance with AI/ML applications will be considered as an asset.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning algorithms and environments.
Familiarity with distributed computing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Hadoop for handling large dataset will be considered an asset.
Ability to give business and technical presentations.
Ability to apply high quality standards.
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in the domain of Artificial Intelligence.
Good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences.
Analysis and problem-solving skills.
Capability to write clear and structured technical documents.
Ability to participate in technical meetings and good communication skills.
Very good knowledge of English (both written and oral).


WHO ARE WE?

VASS (https://vasscompany.com/en/) is a leading digital solutions group of companies headquartered in Madrid, Spain, present in 26 countries in Europe, the Americas and Asia with more than 4,700 professionals

VASS helps large companies in their digital transformation process, developing and executing the most innovative and scalable projects, from strategy to operations.

All our growth comes from our talented people, passion for innovation, and a constant search for improvement, always the VASS way: "Complex made simple".

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family.

We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyoneâ€™s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people.



Fincons is looking for a Data Scientist


The following tasks will be performed by external service provider:

  • Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions;
  • Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience;
  • Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL);
  • Produces data models according to specific problems statements;
  • Scripting and programming;
  • Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etcâ€¦);
  • Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.


All these activities require interactions with business stakeholders and with the IT teams as well as a strong participation in business and/or functional working groups, progress meetings and meetings with the stakeholders (IT and business).


Knowledge and skills

Â· Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools;

Â· Experience with languages like R, Python, PERL;

Â· Proficient in continuous code delivery and unit testing;

Â· Expertise in the ETL processes and tools (i.e. Talend Open Studioâ€¦);

Â· Good knowledge of SQL tooling (NoSQL DB, MongoDB, Hadoop, SQL);

Â· Knowledge of architectural design and implementation of scalable modern data stores;

Â· Knowledge of R-Studio infrastructure is an asset;

Â· Experience in developing interactive R / Python dashboards using packages like Shiny, Dash or similar is an asset;

Â· Experience in developing R / Python functions to perform linear algebra calculations with data frames and arrays, ensuring efficient manipulation of data is an asset;

Â· Experience in using the following libraries (or equivalents) is an asset:

. Data Management: Pandas (tidyverse and dplyr for R), Numpy;

. Data Visualizations: at least one among Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly (ggplot2 for R);

Â· Capability to write clear and structured technical documents;

Â· Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously;

Â· Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering;

Â· Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.


Specific expertise: at least 13 years in the IT Sector.


Knowledge of English is required.


Office: Brussels

Working 80% of the time on site


If interested, please apply!

Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders.

The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

Title: Data Scientist (AI & SaaS platform)
Description:
ALLSTARSIT is a global outstaffing service provider established in 2004. We connect leading tech companies with top talent in software development for various industries, including cybersecurity, AI, healthcare, fintech, IoT, automotive, telecommunications, and media. Headquartered in San Francisco, ALLSTARSIT has development hubs in EU, MENA, APAC, and LATAM regions. The company has been consecutively awarded as the best employer by DOU for two years.







ABOUT THE PROJECT




Our partner is revolutionizing retail with their dynamic pricing B2B SaaS platform, leading the charge in automating and optimizing pricing strategies with AI-driven insights. Their comprehensive solution, embraced by retailers and brands across over 40 markets, delivers actionable pricing recommendations that drive business growth and profitability. Since 2018, they've been empowering a wide range of industries, including consumer electronics, beauty, and apparel, to seamlessly integrate pricing strategies across online and offline channels.




We're looking for a skilled Data Scientist to join our data science team. You'll design, implement, and deploy AI/ML cloud solutions that directly impact our clients' revenue and optimize pricing for millions of products across hundreds of brands. This role offers the opportunity to develop your skills while making a real difference in a dynamic, technology-focused company.







WHAT WILL YOU DO




As a Data Scientist you will be at the forefront of transforming AI-driven pricing solutions. You will:




Develop and Optimize ML Models: Design, develop and fine-tune machine learning and other statistical models to power our dynamic pricing engine, improving prediction accuracy and adapting to market changes.
Own data science projects: Take ownership of data science projects and resources, driving them from concept through to production and continuous improvement.
Advance Generative AI Solutions: Enhance our generative AI solution to automate and optimize pricing strategies.







WHAT WEâ€™LL EXPECT FROM YOU




2+ years of professional experience in:




Machine learning: designing, training and serving models.
Python software development, including OOP, with proven ability to write clean, efficient, and maintainable code.
Data mining, statistical analysis, and data visualization.




Understanding and application of common machine/deep learning algorithms.
Familiarity with key packages (e.g. polars/pandas, pytorch, scikit-learn, statsmodels, xgboost, etc.).




A Masterâ€™s or higher in Computer Science, Physics, Applied Mathematics or a related field, demonstrating a strong foundation in analytical thinking.




Nice-to-haves:




Practical knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale data systems like Hadoop or Spark.
Familiarity with CI/CD processes, services monitoring and software, data & model versioning control.
Experience in analyzing and forecasting time-series data.
A solid grasp of economic principles, such as demand & supply dynamics, price elasticity, and optimization strategies.
Experience with cloud services and platforms, preferably AWS.







If you have a solid foundation in data science and are ready to elevate your career to the next level - we invite you to join our innovative and pioneering team, where your expertise in

data science will significantly influence our path forward.










Looks interesting? ðŸ’«

Apply to the vacancy here or write directly to our Global Recruitment Specialist ðŸ”— https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaroslava-komarenko/

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.

Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical Skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLMâ€™s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLMâ€™s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:
  • Translating business requests into data requirements.
  • Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.
  • Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).
  • Deploying scalable AI applications to production.
  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:
  • MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.
  • Containerized deployment of ML products â€“ e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About RootstockLabs

At RootstockLabs, we believe Bitcoin will underpin humanityâ€™s economic future. But for this to happen, Bitcoinâ€™s functionality must be extended and made available to all. This is why we have been long-standing contributors to Rootstock, the largest and longest-running Bitcoin sidechain. Rootstock allows anyone to develop apps and services on top of the planetâ€™s most secure and decentralised financial infrastructure; Bitcoin.

Today we continue to contribute to Rootstockâ€™s evolution by building tools and technology focused on making Bitcoin work for everyone.




About the Role

RootstockLabs is on the rise, and our data team is expanding to keep pace. To further enhance the Rootstock ecosystem, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our collaborative data team. This role involves working across various teams to assist in identifying the right data, collecting it, and presenting key metrics effectively. Utilize advanced machine learning techniques, including predictive modeling and deep learning, to enhance data analysis capabilities and provide actionable insights for strategic decision-making.




What You'll be Doing

Collect, analyze and monitor Web 3 data, including market trends, trading volumes, and token performance.
Produce reports on current market conditions, web 3 trends and the factors impacting them for tech and non-tech audience to stay on top of the latest developments.
Build and manage advanced ETL, reporting, develop and implement data pipelines, data analysis tools and models to contribute with cross-functional teams and initiatives, and enable teams to self-service where possible, while being the primary point of contact for ad hoc data requests.
Working closely with other data-focused members of RootstockLabs to ensure all employees have access to the data they require
Fuel with know-how the Go To Market initiatives, Product decisions and business strategies to drive data-driven decision-making that fosters the sustainability and growth of the Rootstock ecosystem.




What You Bring to the Table

A degree in a related field such as computer science, statistics, economics, or finance.
A Masterâ€™s or above in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, or similar quantitative/research background is a plus.
Prior experience using data analytics to solve real world problems, often requiring the ability to communicate well to technical and non-technical audiences
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as Python and SQL. Confident to use modern machine learning and data science stacks.
Familiarity with modern machine learning techniques such as classifications, recommendation systems, optimization and preditions, etc
Experience with both extracting (API/Webscocets) and analysing on-chain data using nodes, Infura stack and Chainlink oracles.
Experience in producing Dune Analytic, Covalent, Flipside or Footprint Analytics dashboards or similar
Deep interest and knowledge of Web 3.0 and blockchain is a must â€“ crypto, NFTs, DAOs.
Experience with cryptocurrency and blockchain markets and data sources.
Experience with dashboard development using tools such as Power BI, Tableau or other.
Skilled at modelling and comfortable with building complex spreadsheets/simulations or computer models
Familiarity with A/B testing is a plus
Strong individual contributor who can operate autonomously throughout an organization across all levels and manage multiple projects across stakeholders in a fast-paced environment
Proactive problem solver with the ability to identify challenges and devise multiple effective solutions and with critical thinking skills
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Highly motivated self-starter and fast learner.




What Youâ€™ll get Back!

Competitive salary and company bonus
100% remote working (External Employee) from anywhere in the world
Global WeWork membership
Flexible working hours - youâ€™re free to work however you work best
Paid holidays and personal leave days
Opportunity to work with state of art technology in a challenging and unique project
Internationally diverse and dynamic team with a clear vision and strategy
Training programs to learn everything about the crypto world
Weekly scientific moments by our Research & Innovation team to learn about technology, challenges, and solutions in the blockchain world
Language courses: English, Spanish or Portuguese.
Employee assistance program offering legal, financial, family, psychological, and wellness counselling for you and your family

Title: Data scientist (meteorology)
Description:
Position: Meteorologist Data Scientist




Location Options: Italy / Estonia / Remote




About the Client: Our client, a pioneer in renewable energy innovation, focuses on optimizing wind power generation globally. They employ a range of Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) models combined with cutting-edge machine learning techniques to improve both short and long-term wind forecasts, thereby enhancing the efficiency of wind farm operations.




Ideal Candidate Profile: Our client seeks a highly skilled Meteorologist Data Scientist to enhance their predictive modeling and methodologies. This role is perfect for someone with a blend of meteorological knowledge and data science prowess. If you have a passion for meteorology, data science, and machine learning, and aspire to make a notable impact in the renewable energy sector, they are eager to connect with you!




Primary Responsibilities:

Collaborate with engineering and data science teams to refine wind power forecasting models.
Analyze and interpret various NWP models to identify and rectify local wind anomalies.
Implement Model Output Statistics (MOS) corrections to enhance forecast accuracy and detail.
Employ machine learning techniques to model and downscale NWP grids locally, improving forecast resolution.
Enhance multi-model ensemble methods to optimize wind forecast precision.
Conduct thorough data validation and quality control on meteorological datasets.




Required Qualifications and Skills:

Advanced degree (Masterâ€™s or Ph.D.) in Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, Data Science, or a closely related field.
1-2 years of experience in weather forecasting, data science, or a related area.
Previous experience in the wind power segment of the renewable energy sector is advantageous.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Experience with machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
Proficient in data visualization tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn, or Plotly.
Knowledge of SQL and NoSQL database systems.
Strong understanding of NWP models.
Experience with MOS application.
Familiarity with different meteorological data sources and their practical uses.
Skilled in applying AI and machine learning techniques to weather forecasting.
Ability to develop statistical corrections to improve forecast precision.
Strong skills in data preprocessing, validation, and quality assurance.
Capable of developing, validating, and implementing predictive models.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Effective communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Proactive, innovative, and self-motivated.
Strong organizational and project management abilities.
Proficiency in English; knowledge of Italian is beneficial.




Benefits Include:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Inclusion in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).
Opportunities to work with advanced technologies in the renewable energy field.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.
Potential for career growth and professional development.
Flexible working arrangements (locations include Italy, Tallinn - Estonia, and Remote options).




Join the Team: If you are driven to revolutionize renewable power forecasting through AI and data-driven solutions, apply now to be part of this dynamic team.

Title: Data Scientist with Python
Description:
SEARGIN IS HIRING!




As a dynamic multinational tech company operating in 50 countries, we drive innovation and create projects that shape the future and greatly enhance the quality of life. You will find our solutions in the space industry, supporting scientists in the development of cancer drugs, and implementing innovative technological solutions for industrial clients worldwide. These are just some of the areas in which we operate!




Currently, for the new Seargin project we are looking for a Data Scientist




Location: Remote, Europe

Form of employment: B2B

Industry: Pharma







Recruitment process:




1. Technical screening by Seargin team

2. Final meeting with the manager




Your objectives

You will develop, test and maintain high-quality software using Python programming language
You will designed, developed, and productionize machine learning algorithms
Your activity includes maintaining NLP models on customer feedback
You will work closely with an international team including UX designers, data engineers and BE/FE developers
You will regularly present your findings to our stakeholders




Who you are

You have a university degree with high grades (Master/Diploma, PhD) in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics or a comparable degree
You have 3+ years of experience as a Python Developer
You have expert knowledge in statistics and machine learning
You have routinely designed and developed novel algorithms in production environments
You have good experience with AWS cloud services (e.g. Sagemaker)
You are comfortable querying data from external data sources (knowledge of snowflake is a plus)
You are comfortable with version control systems and issue tracking (e.g. gitlab, jira)
You have excellent problem-solving ability with solid communication and collaboration skills
You have work experience with agile frameworks
Your English is fluent, both spoken and written

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for a Data Scientist. As we are growing fast, we are looking for people to support and participate in this growth. We are looking for a person with a passion for data science, interested in leading concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Python Predictions but also from our clientsâ€™ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then donâ€™t wait any longer and letâ€™s meet.




Who are we looking for?

You have multiple years of experience in a variety of data science applications (not all, but not limited to one either).
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences.
You are as proficient in Python as you are in English, Dutch or French (all other (programming) languages are a plus).
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input.
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way.
You have experience in project management and people management.




What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact.
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania â€“ a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria â€“ a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development.
Great variation in job content due to short and long term missions in different industries, different domains and different environments.
A competitive salary, with plenty of fringe benefits.
A diverse team of supportive colleagues with different backgrounds, skills and interests but shared values whoâ€™ll make you feel right at home.
The opportunity to turn these new colleagues into friends during our legendary afterwork drinks and other exciting events.
In-company training adapted to your personal needs.
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time.
A chance to exploit your talents in our Tobania.Academy and on-the-job coaching.
A workstation at one of our customersâ€™ offices, at Pythonâ€™s Brussels office but also at any Tobaniaâ€™s location!

Discover our Tobania galaxy

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Role:Â Data Scientist

Location: Brussels, BelgiumÂ 

Language: English




Description:

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider as data ETL process manager:

Perform the data collection activities for the Kohesio Platform relying on data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution.
Perform data analysis, convert and update different data types/sets (ETL).
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Designs and deploys data collection and web scraping algorithms using specialised Python libraries.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc., ...).
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks.

Knowledge and skills:

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:

Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Proficient experience with languages like R, Python.
Expertise knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools.
Knowledge of SQL tools
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing â€“ nice to have.
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously.
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering.
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.

Specific Expertise:

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:

Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Data Science. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn.
Track records in cleaning and transforming raw data into a usable format for analysis.
Minimum 2 years of professional ETL tools (e.g. Apache Airflow, dbt)
Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)

â€¢ Excellent command of English




Ideal Candidate:

The ideal candidate should have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Science, excellent command of Python, proficiency with libraries like NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, a minimum of 2 years of experience with ETL tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt), and cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Knowledge of Git Hub and exceptional command of English are required.

  • Track records in cleaning and transforming raw data into a usable format for analysis.
  • Minimum 2 years of professional ETL tools (e.g. Apache Airflow, dbt)
  • Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
  • Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)

â€¢ Excellent command of English


Ideal Candidate:

  • The ideal candidate should have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Science, excellent command of Python, proficiency with libraries like NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, a minimum of 2 years of experience with ETL tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt), and cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Knowledge of Git Hub and exceptional command of English are required.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
As an Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a key role in developing end-to-end solutions for AI use cases. By taking up a use case right from the start you will help business define and scope the problem, pick the right ML solution and technology as well as ensure implementation, integration and deployment of your solution to production. You will do so while ensuring that our internal governance processes and best practices are respected. You will also collaborate with other team members in knowledge sharing as well as continuously improving our way of working.


Responsibilities

  • Develop AI applications using state-of-the-art (Gen)AI technology;
  • Translate business requests into AI applications;
  • Identify high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization;
  • Pilot prototypes in production processes to demonstrate their value;
  • Deploy prototypes to production, with support of IT, to obtain reliable, scalable systems;
  • Present your results in a clear manner and discuss them with multi-functional project teams;
  • Work in close collaboration with business experts (e.g. for requirement gathering, data source identification, data and process understanding, feature engineering, result validation, etc.), with IT (e.g. for ETL, deployment to production, etc.) and with other AI engineers in the team (e.g. for knowledge sharing).


Profile

  • PhD or Master's degree in a quantitative field (Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, etc.)
  • 3+ years of relevant work experience in a business environment


Technical skills

  • Hands-on experience with Python and its AI ecosystem;
  • Strong knowledge of state-of-the-art AI and statistical methods;
  • Experience with cloud technology (Azure);
  • Experience using LLMâ€™s and commonly used libraries to interact with LLMâ€™s (Langchain, Llamaindex, ...);
  • Proven proficiency in the end-to-end AI project life cycle, including:

-Translating business requests into data requirements.

- Identifying high-value use cases through data exploration and visualization.

- Developing AI solutions (incl. feature engineering, model fitting, etc.).

- Deploying scalable AI applications to production.

  • Any experience with following elements is a big plus:

- MLOps practices, e.g. orchestration with Airflow, Gitlab CI/CD, etc.

- Containerized deployment of ML products â€“ e.g. docker, podman, Kubernetes


Attitudes/Behavior

  • Passionate about AI and a constant learner;
  • Result-oriented and highly proficient in transforming data into actionable insights that create business value;
  • Team player with strong communication and presentation skills;
  • Able to manage AI projects in an autonomous way and drive collaboration with domain experts, data engineers and other AI engineers;
  • Knowledge in the field of telecommunications is a plus.


Languages

  • Fluent in Dutch and/or French (mandatory) + Fluent in English.

Title: Data scientist - Brussels - On site
Description:
We are on the lookout for a/an Data scientist to join our team for working with European Institutions based in Bruselles in an On site position.

Get to know us - SEIDOR

At SEIDOR, we drive client transformation and competitiveness with cutting-edge technology and innovation , with a relentless focus on the human element and a commitment to nurturing talent and sustainable growth.

As a diverse and inclusive company that champions equal opportunity, we boast a team of over 8,000 professionals in our global presence across 45 countries in Europe, Latin America, the USA, the Middle East, Africa, and Asia.

We believe the digital world's challenges require not only the best technologies and partnerships but most importantly, the best people. That's where you come in â€“ we need you to help us scale new heights.

For this position you would be working with our client from the European institutions.

Below are the details of your role and requirements.

Your role


Collect business requirement and develop advanced data mining solutions or identify, assess and deploy relevant existing data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solutions.
Specification and design of presentation interfaces with optimal usability/user experience.
Identify, collect, convert and update different data types/sets in several locations (e.g. ETL).
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Scripting and programming.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etcâ€¦).
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks and liaise with other project teams as necessary to address cross-project interdependencies.



Whatâ€™s in it for you?

From day one, youâ€™ll find opportunities for personal and professional development within a supportive team environment. We offer:


A permanent role at a leading tech project firm (subcontractor also possible).
A hybrid work schedule, blending in-office collaboration with the convenience of working from home.
Continuous learning and development through SEIDOR Academy.
A package including salary and additional annual bonus, working equipment, phone and other benefits.
A dynamic international workplace with diverse teams.
A commitment to your well-being, work-life balance, and career growth.
Rapid advancement opportunities in a short period of time.
Engaging events and a comprehensive onboarding program.



At SEIDOR, your growth is our success, and we strive to make our workplace feel like home. Discover the nine core aspects of our culture that define us at SEIDOR:

https://www.seidor.com/en-es/talent

If this resonates with you, we'd love for you to apply to our opening, and we'll be in touch soon!

Requirements:

Who We Think You Are


Very good knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, hypothesis testing, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python and/or R.
Very good experience with data manipulation: Analysis techniques, ability to clean, pre-process, and transform data.
Very good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, etc.
Very good knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and techniques.
Hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised,and reinforcement learning.
Experience with model evaluation, selection and validation techniques.
Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Understanding of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Awareness of involved ethical considerations in data collection and analysis.
Knowledge of applicable data privacy laws and regulations.
Ability to give business and technical presentations.
Ability to apply high quality standards.
Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in the domain of Data Science.
Good communication skills with technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Storytelling with data: Presenting insights in a compelling and understandable way.
Analysis and problem-solving skills.
Capability to write clear and structured documents/reports.
Very good knowledge of English (both written and oral).

Title: Python Data Scientist - LLM Project
Description:
Python Data Scientist/Analyst

Experience: 2 - 18 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6-12 months

Payout: USD 10 - 22 $ per hour

Work timings which is:-primarily, overlap is required from 8 AM to 1 PM PST. The remaining 3 hours can be accommodated either before 8 AM PST or after 1 PM PST

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 6 months

Must-Have

Bachelorâ€™s/Masterâ€™s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist

2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence

2+ years of experience working with Python programming.

Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Data Scientists & Analysts proficient in Python to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with companies in the US looking to develop cutting-edge commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues, but also use your business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Communicate clearly with researchers and help the organization in realizing its objectives
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks, or other suitable mediums
Fix bugs in the code and create thorough documentation
Utilize extensive data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)
Effectively communicate with the researchers to comprehend the needs and provide the results


Job Requirements


Bachelorâ€™s/Masterâ€™s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 2 years of relevant experience as a data scientist
2+ years of data analysis experience and a desire to have a significant impact on the field of artificial intelligence
2+ years of experience working with Python programming
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Machine Learning Engineer - AI for our client, a global organisation who undertaking a large complex digital transformation program. They are looking to bring on board an experienced ML Engineer â€“ AI with extensive experience of Machine Learning, Generative AI, Solution architecture and Data Science platforms.

Key responsibilities:

Responsible to define and implement best practices for building, testing, and deploying scalable AI solutions with a strong focus on generative models and LLM.
Design and implement solutions with the use of ML and Generative AI tools and technologies, with a strong focus on end-to-end automation.
Accountable to build and design cloud hosted generative AI solutions.
Work closely with customers to identify issues and support them in implementation of their ML ecosystem.
Develop Solutions to ensure robust and secure data pipelines and infrastructure to support AI model training and deployment.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in Generative AI and Machine Learning.
Lead the evaluation of new AI tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Dutch or French with good senior level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

4+ yearsâ€™ experience in designing and building AI solutions.
Hands on expertise in ML techniques, deep learning frameworks, image processing and AI-related technologies including Generative AI.
Previous worked across various cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure.
Must have experience of using data science platforms such as Databricks, AzureML, SageMaker and frameworks such as TensorFlow or similar.
Good knowledge of DevOps, MLOps, DataOps and LLMOps principles.
Native Dutch or French speaker and professional working proficiency in English.

Title: Causal Data Scientist / Econometrist
Description:
Job Description

Do you enjoy mining complex data with explanatory analytics? Do you enjoy discovering the underlying drivers? Do you have that reflex to want to test interesting findings for causality? If these questions strike a chord, then you might be the person we are looking for!

Telenet is looking for a Causal Data Scientist / Econometrist to strengthen the Data department of Telenet, centralizing Telenetâ€™s finest in data and analytics. The Causal Data Scientist / Econometrist will join the Business Insights Discovery team of 6 people, tackling strategic questions on a project basis, aiming to make a meaningful impact.

Role Overview


Conduct in-depth data analysis to provide strategic insights and actionable recommendations based on data
Focus on explaining why things are happening and what business should do differently
Set (causality) standards and improve (causal) data analysis practices within the team


Your Responsibilities As a Causal Data Scientist / Econometrist


You take charge of new data problem and sit together with stakeholders to clearly identify the problem and translate it into clear analysis questions and hypothesis
You select appropriate analytics techniques and dive into data to find answers
You collaborate with team members to find the bigger story and patterns
You recognize when the team is getting into causality related questions after which you work together to create solid counterfactuals or test for causality so our conclusions and recommendations are correct
You synthesize complex insights into easy to understand and actionable recommendations that resonate with stakeholders
You coach, inspire and share best practices related to causal data analysis / econometrics


Our Ideal Causal Data Scientist/ Econometrist Has


A Masterâ€™s degreeâ€¯that trained you in Statistics and Econometrics (such as Econometrics, Business Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Quantitative Social Sciences or equivalent)
Solid understanding of what makes good counterfactuals, causal inference. The passion to learn more on this topic and teach others
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and data mining techniques (classification, clustering, regression, â€¦)
A hands-on mentality to really dive into the data and find the answers
Strong data skills with knowledge of at least one coding language (Python, R â€¦). The willingness to learn Python, Pyspark and SQL if not yet proficient
Critical thinking and a problem-solving and result-driven mindset. A drive to manage an analytics initiative end to end, including effective storytelling and stakeholder management
Fluent in English. Knowledge of Dutch/French is a bonus


What We Have To Offer


A varied job in which you produce tangible results and make your mark
Opportunity to work from home 60% of your time (Wednesdays being mandatory in the office)
A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, mobile phone, car option, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, working from home, etc.)
Join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings, on-site padel games and the occasional afterwork drinks

Title: Machine Learning and AI Consultant
Description:
Location: Hybrid, Brussels (5 days per month on site; living max 2.5 hours driving distance from Brussels)

Role type: B2b contract




Description

We are working towards turning digital visions into reality. We are continuously growing and we are looking for a Machine Learning and AI Consultant to join our UniQue team.




What will you be bringing to the team?

Master Degree in IT or related field with at least 13 years of experience in IT.
Extensive hands-on experience with the design and implementation of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG).
Very good knowledge of programming in Python (programming in R is considered an asset).
Very good experience with libraries and frameworks like TensorFlow, Hugging Face, PyTorch, scikitlearn, or Keras.
Very good knowledge with using cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for designing/implementing scalable AI/ML/RAG/etc. solutions.
Extensive hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms, including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
Good knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.
Knowledge of the involved Mathematics and Statistics (Linear algebra, Calculus, Probability theory, Statistics, Optimization techniques, etc.).
Good knowledge of data pre-processing and analysis techniques.
Good experience with data visualization using tools like Matplotlib, Seaborn or Plotly.
Good experience with RDBMS like Oracle (latest version).
Good experience of NoSQL databases like MongoDB or Cassandra.
Experience in training deep learning models.
Good knowledge of NLP techniques and libraries like NLTK, spaCy, or Transformers.
Extensive experience with model evaluation and validation techniques.
Extensive experience with deploying ML models to production.
Good knowledge of potential bias and fairness issues in AI systems.
Knowledge of the applicable data privacy regulations (GDPR) and compliance with AI/ML applications will be considered as an asset.
Familiarity with reinforcement learning algorithms and environments.
Familiarity with distributed computing frameworks such as Apache Spark or Hadoop for handling large dataset will be considered an asset.
Fluent in English at least at a level B2.

Title: AI Research Engineer
Description:
ðŸš€ Join Our AI Team in Leuven to Shape the Future of Predictive Planning ðŸš€




At Predikt, weâ€™re assembling a stellar AI team to build the worldâ€™s first financial digital twin. At the heart of this twin is a causal, human-in-the-loop, automated, multivariate time-series forecasting engine. This engine is powered by our custom AI stack and proprietary algorithms that were originally developed by our two technical founders (PhDs) at the KU Leuven machine learning lab. Weâ€™re looking for an ambitious AI research engineer to join our team and build out a next-generation product with us.




About Predikt

Predikt is a dynamic Swiss-Belgian deeptech company at the forefront of innovation, developing cutting-edge AI-driven technology. Our solutions are designed to identify external business drivers and assess their impact on organizations, empowering businesses to make data-driven decisions with confidence. As an early-stage startup, we are fueled by a strong sense of mission and enthusiasm, striving to democratize data-driven decision-making on a global scale. Weâ€™re collaborating with leading organizations across the globe and backed by veteran entrepreneurs and angel investors




At Predikt, we are defined by our core values and high ambitions. We are a company that champions integrity, innovation, and excellence, creating an environment where everyone supports each other and works collaboratively towards common goals. Our customer-centric approach ensures we deliver exceptional value and service, while fostering a culture of mutual respect, open communication, and continuous improvement.

Join us on this exciting journey as we transform the landscape of data driven intelligence and create a future where data-driven decision-making is accessible to everyone making decisions.




About the Role




Responsibilities




AI Research and Development:Conduct research to develop innovative AI models and algorithms.

Experiment with and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve product performance.
Implement algorithms, set up experiments to test their performance, evaluate the results, design improvements, and repeat.
Collaborate with academic and industry partners to stay at the forefront of AI advancements.




Collaboration and Teamwork:Work closely with software engineers to integrate AI models into production systems.

Working with customers to test, improve, and deliver forecasting models
Proactively help out the team with bottlenecks (for example in software engineering or customer-facing analyses)

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to make a significant impact in the retail industry with your expertise in data science and machine learning? We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join a leading retail company dedicated to improving lives through better food. This company serves millions of customers weekly across Belgium and Luxembourg.




About the Role

As the Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing advanced machine learning and AI models. Your work will drive better decision-making, enhance customer experiences, and improve operational efficiency.







Key Responsibilities

Collect, interpret, and analyze internal and external data to make actionable recommendations for various departments.
Create and implement descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive models using agile principles to deliver impactful data products.
Continuously explore new data sources, algorithms, and technologies to foster data-driven decision-making.
Communicate model choices and their benefits effectively to product teams, aligning with business strategy and available data.
Manage analytical projects and translate business needs into clear deliverables with defined success criteria and KPIs.




Qualifications

Masterâ€™s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, AI, Computer Science, Civil Engineering, Business Administration (with data analytics/data science orientation), or related fields.
Proven experience in one or more of the following areas: data science, machine learning, software engineering, data engineering, and coding.
Proficiency in Python, PySpark, Machine Learning, statistics, and analytics.
Strong soft skills: eager to learn, excellent communication, curiosity, teamwork, listening, understanding, and presentation skills.
Fluency in English; Dutch or French is a plus.

Title: Machine Learning Specialist
Description:
Platform Manager and Senior Machine Learning Specialist




About the Client: Our client is an Italian company with an international presence, offering superior performance in short-term and day-ahead renewable power forecasting through their ML-empowered SaaS platform. They focus on delivering innovative, AI and data-driven solutions to the renewable forecasting industry.




Ideal Candidate Profile: The client seeks a highly skilled Platform Manager and Senior Machine Learning Specialist to lead their data platform. The ideal candidate will possess strong machine learning engineering skills, cloud infrastructure experience, and the ability to develop scalable solutions. This role also involves coordinating a team of developers and technical partners to achieve strategic objectives.




Primary Responsibilities:

Take full ownership of the cloud platform, ensuring routine maintenance, upgrades, and proactively addressing any issues.
Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable cloud solutions on Microsoft Azure.
Oversee and manage the cloud-based data platform, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.
Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters for containerized applications.
Implement and maintain complex workflow orchestration.
Develop and maintain PostgreSQL databases and data storage solutions.
Maintain and improve MLOps procedures and CI/CD pipelines to ensure reliable and efficient production systems.
Develop and maintain APIs to facilitate seamless integrations.
Lead the implementation of new ML or business functionalities.
Lead a team of developers and technical partners, providing guidance, mentorship, and support.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into the SaaS platform.
Ensure best practices in data engineering, model deployment, and infrastructure management.
Provide technical direction for an ML/FS development team.




Required Qualifications and Skills:

Proven experience in machine learning engineering and cloud infrastructure management.
3-5 years of relevant experience.
Expertise in the ML/AI field, specifically within the Python stack.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
Ability to design and develop scalable data solutions.
Excellent leadership and team coordination skills.
Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Experience managing and optimizing Kubernetes clusters.
Proficiency in developing and maintaining PostgreSQL databases.
Expertise in maintaining and improving MLOps procedures and CI/CD pipelines.
Ability to develop and maintain APIs for seamless integrations.
Effective communication skills in English; knowledge of Italian is a plus.




Benefits Include:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Inclusion in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP).
Opportunities to work with advanced technologies in the renewable energy field.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.
Potential for career growth and professional development.
Flexible working arrangements (locations include Italy, Tallinn - Estonia, and Remote options).




Join the Team: If you are passionate about machine learning and cloud technologies and aspire to make a significant impact in the renewable energy industry, apply now to be part of this dynamic team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Tasks:

Following tasks will be performed by external service provider as data ETL process manager:


Perform the data collection activities for the Kohesio Platform relying on data mining, machine learning and business intelligence solution.
Perform data analysis, convert and update different data types/sets (ETL).
Produces data models according to specific problems statements.
Designs and deploys data collection and web scraping algorithms using specialised Python libraries.
Contribute to the design and implementation of the analytics architecture and its solution stack (including performance aspects, physical design, capacity dimensions etc., ...).
Write the different documentation associated with the tasks.



Job Requirements

Knowledge and skills

Following skills and knowledge are required for the performance of the above listed tasks:


Excellent knowledge of Data Analytics techniques and tools.
Proficient experience with languages like R, Python.
Expertise knowledge of business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).
Expertise in the ETL processes and tools.
Knowledge of SQL tools
Experience in Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing â€“ nice to have.
Ability to work in a team as well as autonomously.
Results-oriented mindset, focused on delivering.
Good communication skills in English, both orally and in written form.



Specific Expertise:

Following specific expertise is mandatory for the performance of tasks:


Minimum 3 years of professional experience in Data Science. Excellent command of Python and proficiency with relevant libraries, including but not limited to NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn.
Track records in cleaning and transforming raw data into a usable format for analysis.
Minimum 2 years of professional ETL tools (e.g. Apache Airflow, dbt)
Track record of implemented solutions that solved business problems and produced tangible results
Minimum 2 year with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud). Experience with Knowledge Graphs and SPARQL is an asset.
Minimum 2 years of experience with version control system (Git Hub)
Excellent command of English

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
CluePoints is a fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Quality Management and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products utilize advanced statistical and machine learning algorithms to assess the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. At CluePoints, we are looking for people with fresh ideas to keep developing our algorithms and help us to sustain our growth.

Responsibilities

As a member of our Research team:


You develop new machine learning models to enhance the CluePoints web platform and/or to develop new products.
You identify promising ML techniques from scientific literature and assess their viability
You leverage relevant open-source resources and keep yourself up-to-date to new developments in this area
You produce robust and clean python code
You follow ML best practices to keep track of experiments and models
You identify new fields of applications for machine learning and deep learning within CluePoints and contribute to increased adoption of machine learning within the healthcare industry
You stay on the edge of relevant research and help CluePoints to continue increasing its scientific visibility by participating at scientific conferences and publishing in scientific journals


Main Qualifications


Master or PhD in Computer sciences or quantitative fields (maths, physics, ...)
Professional experience in machine learning / data science
Efficient in Python
Good knowledge in at least one deep learning platform like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with deep learning and natural language Processing
Experience in supporting deployments of machine learning models
Experience with medical data
Experience in GPU computing


Top reasons to work with us:


Flexibility is part of our DNA and youâ€™ll find at CluePoints you can work 100% from home or choose to come to the office any day (please note that this point only concerns employees located in our office in Belgium).
If you choose to come to the office, youâ€™ll discover a fun atmosphere including a game room (e.g., withkicker, PS4, arcade machine, nerf battles, and our newly added dartboard).
Many activities are organized during the year, such as soccer, team lunches, happy hours, LAN parties, board games nights! We also have running groups, languages lessons, and much more!
Youâ€™ll be working within a squad organization offering you ownership on projects, and utilize high quality equipment like powerful laptops and screens.
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: youâ€™ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
Youâ€™ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
Youâ€™ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards!
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits, company car, bonus potential, employee referral program.

Title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Software Engineer




Distributed ML Training




Location: Fully Remote

Type: Full-time




Join an innovative Series A Deep Tech company at the forefront of AI and blockchain technology! Backed by top investors with over $50 million in funding, our client is a team of 20 industry experts, looking to grow to 35. They are leveraging blockchain to provide globally accessible computing resources for AI platforms and are seeking world-class engineers to accelerate AI progress. This is a fully remote role offering a high level of autonomy.




Responsibilities:




ML Orchestration System Design: Develop systems for orchestrating ML execution across decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure.
Performance Optimization: Profile and optimize training algorithms continually.
Implement Novel Research: Build new mechanisms and algorithms to solve unprecedented problems.
Engineering Support: Collaborate on broader ML issues, such as reproducible training.
Technical Writing and Engagement: Contribute to technical reports and papers, and engage with the community.




Minimum Requirements:




Distributed Foundation Model Training: Experience designing or working with training systems on large clusters.
Networking Proficiency: Understanding and troubleshooting experience with IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, and communication backends like NCCL, GLOO, and MPI.
Open Source Contributions: Experience with large open-source codebases as a maintainer or trusted contributor.
Rust Enthusiasm: Willingness to learn Rust to work across the codebase.
Computer Science Background: Solid understanding of computational complexity and broad knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
Self-motivation and Communication: Highly self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Applied Research Comfort: Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable applied research environment.




Bonus Skills:




Rust Expertise: Strong experience with systems programming in Rust, understanding lifetimes, and the purpose of Pin.
Research Experience: Published research in distributed systems or ML domains.
Blockchain Knowledge: Understanding of blockchain fundamentals.







Be part of a team dedicated to democratizing AI, where you can leverage your expertise in distributed ML training, networking, and open-source contributions to make a significant impact. Embrace autonomy, continuous learning, and the drive to push innovative solutions in a highly collaborative and flexible environment.




Apply now to join this cutting-edge team and contribute to the future of AI!

  • Implement Novel Research: Build new mechanisms and algorithms to solve unprecedented problems.
  • Engineering Support: Collaborate on broader ML issues, such as reproducible training.
  • Technical Writing and Engagement: Contribute to technical reports and papers, and engage with the community.


Minimum Requirements:


  • Distributed Foundation Model Training: Experience designing or working with training systems on large clusters.
  • Networking Proficiency: Understanding and troubleshooting experience with IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP, and communication backends like NCCL, GLOO, and MPI.
  • Open Source Contributions: Experience with large open-source codebases as a maintainer or trusted contributor.
  • Rust Enthusiasm: Willingness to learn Rust to work across the codebase.
  • Computer Science Background: Solid understanding of computational complexity and broad knowledge of algorithms and data structures.
  • Self-motivation and Communication: Highly self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Applied Research Comfort: Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable applied research environment.


Bonus Skills:


  • Rust Expertise: Strong experience with systems programming in Rust, understanding lifetimes, and the purpose of Pin.
  • Research Experience: Published research in distributed systems or ML domains.
  • Blockchain Knowledge: Understanding of blockchain fundamentals.



Be part of a team dedicated to democratizing AI, where you can leverage your expertise in distributed ML training, networking, and open-source contributions to make a significant impact. Embrace autonomy, continuous learning, and the drive to push innovative solutions in a highly collaborative and flexible environment.


Apply now to join this cutting-edge team and contribute to the future of AI!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to shape the future of AI? Clario are looking for a visionary AI Engineer to propel our innovative journey forward in the clinical trials and pharmaceutical industries. Dive into the heart of AI research and development, where your expertise in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering will fuel transformative solutions that redefine business success and directly impact the lives of patients globally.




What we offer

Competitive compensation
Attractive benefits (security, flexibility, support and well-being)
Remote or hybrid working
Full technology setup and support




What you'll be doing

The AI Engineer will play a key role in researching, designing, developing, and implementing AI-based solutions that drive business objectives and contribute to the advancement of our AI capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, and software engineering, along with a passion for tackling challenging problems using AI techniques.

Research, design, and implement ML/Deep Learning models applied to natural language processing, data classification, and other areas.
Design and implement solutions leveraging state of the art GenAI models, including Large Language models.
Participate in the fine-tuning of LLMs, including the preparation of data sets.
Perform required accuracy measures and model validations.
Collaborate with product managers, domain experts, and medical scientists to define requirements.
Partner with software engineers for seamless integration of AI models, ensuring operational success.
Engage with scientific literature to stay ahead of emerging trends.
Drive automation and efficiency improvements in our workflows.
Provide support to internal teams, facilitating resolution of technical issues.
Identify and pursue new opportunities to add value to the organization and departmental processes.
Foster a collaborative environment, supporting colleagues in achieving collective and individual goals.




What we look for

Degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics, or a related field
3+ Years of experience Developing natural language processing models/applications with a proficiency in programming languages such as Python or C++
Performing model training across different model architectures and data modalities
Strong understanding of various Deep Learning techniques.
Past experience developing AI models for the healthcare and life science industry a plus.
Solid understanding of machine learning tools and techniques (e.g., Pytorch, Keras, TensorFlow, Pandas, Scikit-learn).
Familiarity with software and systems engineering concepts, including cloud computing, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD) is a plus.
Exceptional motivational and team-building skills, fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment. Ability to work in group setting and independently.
Ability to organize and prioritize assigned tasks to meet established schedules, timelines, or deadlines.
Problem solving abilities.
Excellent attention to detail and meticulous work.




At Clario, we put people first, always. We are united and driven by patients, committed to making a difference, and we are always looking for the best talent to help us transform lives. We value the contribution each of our people brings. Itâ€™s only through our people that we can continue to innovate technology that will shape the future of clinical trials.




Clario is committed to providing an inclusive workplace that welcomes diversity and equal opportunity. We encourage all qualified candidates who are passionate about sustainability, ethical business, and making a positive impact to apply for this role.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you will need to be able to adapt quickly to new technologies, applications and environments. You will operate with our current clients on a medium to long-term basis.

As an ML Engineer, you will help our clients building and serving machine learning models. More specifically, the responsibilities include:

Design and implement solutions to serve machine learning models, from traditional ML to Generative AI.
Train, improve, and deploy ML models.
Write production ready code and serve online, batch, and real time models
Identify, design, and implement process improvements in the machine learning lifecylce: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-design infrastructure for greater scalability, etc
Collaborate with Data Scientists, MLOps Engineers and Data Engineers, to integrate all parts of the solution.
Coach colleagues and clients in your area of expertise







Who are we looking for?

Required

Master or PhD in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Engineering, or related field.
At least 3 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Scientist, MLOps Engineer, or in a similar position.
Strong software engineering background
Experience deploying machine learning in production
Experience with experiment tracking, models monitoring, and deployment strategies
Ability to write production ready code in Python.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and understanding of Infrastructure as Code
Knowledge of containers and container orchestration.
Master software engineering best practices and software release cycle.
Solid understanding of Linux and in depth knowledge of at least one cloud provider.
Knowledge of big data technologies such as Apache Spark, Kafka.
Able to coach others and give technical advice and direction.Experience building, scheduling and maintaining ML pipelines
Able to work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively
Proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus







What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania â€“ a leading Belgian business & technology consulting. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria â€“ a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development
Great variation in job content due to missions in different industries, different domains and different environments
In-company training adapted to your personal needs
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time
A great team of colleagues with shared values

Discover our Tobania galaxy
