Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
ðŸ¤– The Job

Dataroots researches, designs and codes robust AI-solutions & platforms for various sectors, with a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps. As Machine Learning Engineer you are part of our dedicated in-house team of AI-specialists. You excel in building machine learning models which result in our robust and production-ready solutions to optimise company processes.

You love data and turning data inside out to reveal all its secrets. You are an expert in developing and implementing various statistical and machine learning models and you are in charge of controlling the performances of your models output. You love to experiment with different approaches to ensure your client the best-in-class solution. To achieve this, you collaborate closely with our data engineers and/or cloud architects on projects for various sectors, always with a quality focused, end-to-end approach. The result? Our teams provide clients a reliable foundation to make data-driven decisions.

As a senior, you will also build and share knowledge with your colleagues. Through a multitude of initiatives, you have various chances to share your knowledge and keep up to date with the latest developments in the field.




ðŸŽ‰ What you can expect at Dataroots

Dataroots was founded in 2016 and, since its beginnings, has focused on helping its customers achieve excellence in their data-driven operations. The only way to do this sustainably is by investing in team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing and customer experience. This quality-first focus has allowed sustained and healthy growth over the years. Join a team where you can have an impact on our growth story. Read up more on our DNA over at [https://dataroots.io/our-dna].




ðŸ’ª The Skills

You have a knack for Machine Learning and have attained a Masters or Doctorate in a quantitative field.
You have a strong background and are opinionated on software design principles.
You have at least 2 years experience in a field related to machine learning and big data.
You have a strong theoretical basis and experience in general machine learning & deep learning.
You are excellent in Python. Experience in SQL is a big plus, knowledge of R or Scala is a bonus.
You have an initial experience in deploying ML models and expertise in MLOps.
You have a basic understanding of cloud engineering.
You get excited by large amounts of data.
You approach problems with a pragmatic mindset.
You have strong communication skills and can translate complex solutions into clear and understandable explanations.
You have a good overview over the (big-)data ecosystem.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.




Was this list a bit much? Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.




ðŸ’° The Offer

* An attractive salary package with extralegal benefits such as a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, and a high-end laptop and a smartphone.

* A personal & team training budget to further your professional career.

* Your innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and open-source projects within your guild.

* (Virtual) Team Buildings, team gatherings to let off steam and be part of our sports initiatives.




ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ª Our main offices are in Leuven, Ghent and Utrecht ðŸ‡³ðŸ‡± , with co-working spaces in Charleroi and Antwerp. These locations are always available for brainstorming sessions or team events. As a Dataroots consultant, much work can be performed remotely, but you will most likely also visit our clients on-site.




Ready for a new chapter as a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Super! Apply now! ðŸŽ‰

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps)
Description:
Just as every tooth is unique and requires precision in its care, our AI solutions demand precision in their design and implementation. At Promaton, we're revolutionizing dental healthcare with AI, and we need your expertise. See our company page to learn more about what we do.

As a Software Engineer in Machine Learning you will be working closely with our platform and product teams, enabling fast iterations and scalable ML solutions for existing and future products. You will extend our already successful track record of 5 ML products processing thousands of cases weekly for over 1K customers.




As part of our dynamic team, you will be:

Improving and contributing to the design and architecture of a complex set of interdependent ML pipelines.
Following MLOps best practices by maintaining and extending our CI/CD pipelines, dashboards, dev/test/prod environments, autoscaling, etc.
Working with an accomplished team of machine learning researchers and engineers that already have 8 patents on their name.
Helping researchers launch new products and help maintain the ones already used by customers.

Some initiatives on our MLOps roadmap for the next months:

1. Improving speed and robustness of multiple machine learning products

2. Continuous monitoring of incoming data in production

The challenges youâ€™ll face:

All our products process large data points, ranging from 5 up to 700MB. This means that a lot of off-the-shelf tooling doesn't work for us, and we need to invent our own to process and manage our data.
Our teams are growing and so is our code base. This comes with the challenge to keep it well-designed and maintainable.
We are a cloud-native company, and cloud-native ML frameworks are still in their early days. You'll help us navigate the ever-evolving ecosystem of tools, to make sure we find the right balance between off-the-shelf and home-grown tooling.
Medical AI has to comply with the highest quality standards. While in other industries failing to predict for example a recommended product has little consequence, in the medical field you don't want to be wrong.




The perks of working at Promaton:

ðŸ’° Attractive salary package, and excellent employment terms

ðŸ¡ Excellent work/life balance. Freedom to work from home or anywhere you like (and any time you like). We only have a few touchpoints.

ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ”¬ Dedicated time for hackathons and growth, to explore new ideas of your own. Every quarter we have a hackathon week where you can work on anything you like to expand your skill set!

ðŸ™Œ Staying up to date with the latest happenings in the ML field can be hard. That is why we organize monthly paper review sessions to discuss the latest developments in the field to stay up to date with the current state-of-the-art. Next to that we regularly hold â€œML Sparring Sessionsâ€ where you can spar with other MLRs in the company on potential directions for projects you are working on.

ðŸŽ“ Real training budget for books and conferences or anything else you need to grow

ðŸš€ Work with the latest technology, at the forefront of a rapidly developing field in medical imaging AI. Checkout our techstack here.

ðŸ’ª Loads of responsibility and autonomy (we hate micromanagement) and a chance to make a real impact

ðŸ– Awesome yearly company retreat, and quarterly team events

â›ºï¸ 32 days of annual leave

ðŸ’» Top-notch gear, and even bigger servers to play with

ðŸ„â€â™‚ï¸ Promaton is funded for many years to come, meaning you can have the impact you only get at a startup, but with the job security of an established company

ðŸ›¬ For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship

ðŸŽˆInclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity




Job requirements

4+ years experience working with Python and Pytorch
Solid understanding of software development best practices
A passion for software and ML pipeline design concepts
The git ecosystem is your natural habitat
Know how good tests improve developer velocity
Experience with continuous deployment of live products
Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deployment
Good collaboration and communication skills

Bonus points:

Experience with experiment, model and data tracking
Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals
Worked with 3D data, like meshes and point clouds
Experience working asynchronously with a distributed team
Previous experience in medical or other regulated field




We're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!

  • Improving and contributing to the design and architecture of a complex set of interdependent ML pipelines.
  • Following MLOps best practices by maintaining and extending our CI/CD pipelines, dashboards, dev/test/prod environments, autoscaling, etc.
  • Working with an accomplished team of machine learning researchers and engineers that already have 8 patents on their name.
  • Helping researchers launch new products and help maintain the ones already used by customers.

Some initiatives on our MLOps roadmap for the next months:

1. Improving speed and robustness of multiple machine learning products

2. Continuous monitoring of incoming data in production

The challenges youâ€™ll face:

  1. All our products process large data points, ranging from 5 up to 700MB. This means that a lot of off-the-shelf tooling doesn't work for us, and we need to invent our own to process and manage our data.
  2. Our teams are growing and so is our code base. This comes with the challenge to keep it well-designed and maintainable.
  3. We are a cloud-native company, and cloud-native ML frameworks are still in their early days. You'll help us navigate the ever-evolving ecosystem of tools, to make sure we find the right balance between off-the-shelf and home-grown tooling.
  4. Medical AI has to comply with the highest quality standards. While in other industries failing to predict for example a recommended product has little consequence, in the medical field you don't want to be wrong.


The perks of working at Promaton:

ðŸ’° Attractive salary package, and excellent employment terms

ðŸ¡ Excellent work/life balance. Freedom to work from home or anywhere you like (and any time you like). We only have a few touchpoints.

ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ”¬ Dedicated time for hackathons and growth, to explore new ideas of your own. Every quarter we have a hackathon week where you can work on anything you like to expand your skill set!

ðŸ™Œ Staying up to date with the latest happenings in the ML field can be hard. That is why we organize monthly paper review sessions to discuss the latest developments in the field to stay up to date with the current state-of-the-art. Next to that we regularly hold â€œML Sparring Sessionsâ€ where you can spar with other MLRs in the company on potential directions for projects you are working on.

ðŸŽ“ Real training budget for books and conferences or anything else you need to grow

ðŸš€ Work with the latest technology, at the forefront of a rapidly developing field in medical imaging AI. Checkout our techstack here.

ðŸ’ª Loads of responsibility and autonomy (we hate micromanagement) and a chance to make a real impact

ðŸ– Awesome yearly company retreat, and quarterly team events

â›ºï¸ 32 days of annual leave

ðŸ’» Top-notch gear, and even bigger servers to play with

ðŸ„â€â™‚ï¸ Promaton is funded for many years to come, meaning you can have the impact you only get at a startup, but with the job security of an established company

ðŸ›¬ For international engineers, based in the NL (already relocated to the Netherlands) we are able to offer visa sponsorship

ðŸŽˆInclusive environment, we value and celebrate diversity


Job requirements

  • 4+ years experience working with Python and Pytorch
  • Solid understanding of software development best practices
  • A passion for software and ML pipeline design concepts
  • The git ecosystem is your natural habitat
  • Know how good tests improve developer velocity
  • Experience with continuous deployment of live products
  • Experience with AWS/GCP/Azure or Kubernetes deployment
  • Good collaboration and communication skills

Bonus points:

  • Experience with experiment, model and data tracking
  • Knowledge of machine learning fundamentals
  • Worked with 3D data, like meshes and point clouds
  • Experience working asynchronously with a distributed team
  • Previous experience in medical or other regulated field


We're excited to see how you can make a difference in our team. If you're passionate about making a tangible impact in healthcare through AI, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist

Our goal is to create the most personalized, effective, and inspiring educational journey online and through our sales channels, helping students worldwide achieve personal growth.




Role: Senior Data Scientist

Location: Remote/ Germany

Salary: â‚¬100,000

Develop and implement predictive models for cutting-edge dynamic recommender systems and content creation, utilizing customer data to enhance personalized sales experiences.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description:
Role: Machine Learning Researcher

Location: Europe (fully remote)

Salary: $150,000 - $200,000 + equity at a rapidly growing AI startup




About Us: We are a dynamic and innovative technology company specializing in financial data automation and analytics. Our mission is to revolutionize the way financial data is processed and analyzed through cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technologies. Join us and be a part of a team that is transforming the financial industry.




Job Description: As a Machine Learning Researcher with a deep specialization in Deep Learning, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our machine learning capabilities. You will work closely with a talented team of researchers and engineers to develop state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms and models that enhance our data processing and analytical systems. Your work will directly impact the efficiency and accuracy of financial data analysis, contributing to the success of our clients and the growth of our company.




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct cutting-edge research and development in deep learning to solve complex problems in financial data automation and analytics.
Design, implement, and evaluate advanced deep learning models and algorithms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate deep learning solutions into production systems.
Analyze large and complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and identify patterns.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in deep learning and AI, and apply them to improve existing systems.
Publish research findings in top-tier conferences and journals.
Mentor and guide junior researchers and interns.




Qualifications:

Ph.D. or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or a related field, with a focus on deep learning.
Proven experience in deep learning research, with a strong publication record in top-tier conferences and journals.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Extensive knowledge of deep learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras).
Experience with NLP, time series analysis, and large-scale data processing using deep learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience in the financial services industry or related domains.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible work hours and remote work options.
Opportunity to work on groundbreaking projects and make a significant impact in the financial industry.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.

Join us and leverage your deep learning expertise to drive innovation and excellence in financial data automation and analytics. Apply now to become a part of our forward-thinking team.

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
OLSYS provides full-service solutions for mid-market and enterprise organizations.

With 15+ years of experience, 100+ projects, and 50+ strong technical experts in the team, we continue to grow by expanding our development team in Europe, as well as expanding the base of new clients and projects.

As an enterprise software development company, we are building long-term partnerships helping our clients accelerate their digital experiences with reasonable IT investments.

Our tailored approach, e-commerce focus, and flexible solutions allow us to design, develop, and deliver scalable, integrated commerce platforms that drive profits and boost the business.

Our Industry Focus

â€” Banking and Finance (business continuity management, planning system, banking app development);

â€” Retail and E-Commerce (B2B Commerce, B2C Commerce, Digital/E-Commerce customer experience);

â€” Healthcare (website development for Healthcare organizations).

Our Expertise Includes

â€” Commerce Solutions

â€” Development Services

â€” Creative Services

â€” Quality Assurance and Testing

â€” Maintenance and Support

â€” E-Commerce Consulting

The Role

Responsibilities


Interact with the modern LLMs and adopt the best practices of their usage.
R&D activities (experimenting with LLMs): Generate code based on the input description. Build test cases based on the user scenarios.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of the models and make adjustments as necessary to maintain or enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Data Preprocessing and Annotation: Work with the Data Engineering team to preprocess and annotate the training data for AI/ML models. Collaborate with subject matter experts to create labeled datasets that facilitate supervised and unsupervised learning.
Prototyping and Evaluation: Rapidly prototype and iterate different AI/ML approaches to identify the most suitable solution to meet the requirements.


Perform rigorous evaluations to measure the model's performance against defined metrics.


Documentation: Document all stages of the AI/ML development process, including design choices, architecture, algorithms, and evaluation results, ensuring knowledge transfer and team understanding.
Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Software Engineers.
Stay Abreast of Industry Trends: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, NLP, LLM and other relevant technologies. Integrate new research findings and methodologies into the project as applicable.


Ideal Profile


Experience: Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI, Interactive Chatbots, Graph databases.
Data Processing: Experience in preprocessing and handling large-scale, unstructured text data, and the ability to perform data analysis and validation.
Problem-solving and Innovation: Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges, think innovatively, and propose creative solutions to real-world problems.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


English level: Upper-Intermediate

What's on Offer?


You can contribute and influence the development of a new product
Work with AI product
Flexible working options

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Description:
As a Data & AI Engineer, you will turn our customersâ€™ ambitions into practical data and AI-driven projects. You are a tech-savvy process enthusiast, skilled in data management, and passionate about tackling intricate challenges. You will dive deep into a project's details to ensure its success.




Location: Main office in Kontich (BE), hubs in Ghent (BE) & Woerden (NL)




What you'll do




Understand the data ecosystem and its role in engineering and machine learning solutions.
Use enterprise knowledge and data to guide our clients toward data-driven decision-making.
Help stakeholders understand data architecture, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, visualisation, and reporting.
Bridge the gap between IT and business and drive organisational change with soft skills.
Drive client growth and transformation through your meaningful contributions.




What you're good at




You know how to work with the Microsoft Azure suite, Databricks, and Microsoft Fabric. Experience with visualisation tools is a big plus.
You know how to work with SQL and/or Python. Experience with writing ETLs and cloud computing is a plus.
You have strong analytical skills, and you love delving into details.
You have experience with business analytics and handling large sets of data.
You have excellent communication skills: you can effortlessly explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
You're intrigued by cutting-edge technologies such as generative AI.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or English. Proficiency in French is a big plus.




This could be you




I love showing our clients a new perspective on their business processes and helping them see how things really work. Add bullet point: make an impact at the client and help them grow/transform.

Title: AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are software engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are are developers who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. Ubuntu is used by pretty much every enterprise in the world, in every industry. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn about the open source technology landscape and develop your business technology insights. You will see first hand in various industries how Linux - and Ubuntu in particular - is shaping innovation and changing the world for the better.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple K8s clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack, and Spark
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets
Global travel up to 25% of time for internal and external events and 25% to customer meetings


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust.
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualisation, containers and networking
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics
Intermediate level Python programming skills
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training
Wide range of open source applications and skills
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Employee Assistance Programme
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring an AI/ML and MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
I'm partnered with a leading consultancy firm based in Brussels hiring for a Computer Vision enthusiast.




They are seeking a skilled and experienced Computer Vision Engineer to join their dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in computer vision and a passion for developing innovative solutions to real-world problems. You will work closely with our clients to design, implement, and deploy computer vision applications that enhance their business operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement computer vision algorithms to solve problems in various domains such as healthcare, automotive, manufacturing, and retail.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand client requirements and deliver customized computer vision solutions.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior engineers and interns.
Document project progress and results, and present findings to clients and stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in computer vision and machine learning.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, C++, or Java.
Strong communication skills in English; proficiency in French or Dutch is a plus.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with edge computing and deploying models on edge devices.
Familiarity with augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) applications.
Knowledge of software development methodologies and tools (e.g., Agile, Git, Docker).




What They Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Company car + fuelcard
NET Allowances.
Insurances
A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Access to the latest technology and tools.




If this role is of interest, feel free to contact me on LinkedIn or below:

Number: +31 (0) 203 997 864

Email: Daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description


Build solution accelerators aligned to current business needs and defined use cases.
Assist is development, and deployment of advanced generative models to production.
Optimize and fine-tune existing LLMs/generative models through iterative prompt engineering for improved performance, efficiency.
Develop LLMOps/CI-CD pipeline for timely deployment of new features and updates.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand project requirements and translate them into effective generative AI solutions.
Drive research initiatives to explore cutting-edge advancements in generative AI
Evaluate and integrate relevant AI technologies when applicable, assessing their impact on project objectives.
Documentation of models, algorithms, and implementation processes for knowledge sharing and future reference


Skills Required


Experience in data extraction/transformation techniques using OCRs, Website crawlers and document extractors from websites, social media platforms, PDFs, images, etc.
Strong foundation of NLP, with robust knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM) and Small Language Models (SLM)
In depth understanding of RAG (Vector DB, Knowledge Graph) architecture and Agent Based Framework
Proficient in Prompt engineering techniques (Zero-shot prompting, Chain-of-thought prompts, Contextual augmentation, Human-in-the-loop)
Understanding of foundational deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, huggingface, etc
Hands on experience with Cloud AI/Cognitive services (preferably Azure) for text/audio/image/video modalities.
Proficiency in Python, Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), API Development (Fast/Rest), Pyspark and Git.
Nice to have experience in low code UI platform like Streamlit, Gradio, Chainlit for quick POCs
Good in communication and collaboration skills
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

  • Build solution accelerators aligned to current business needs and defined use cases.
  • Assist is development, and deployment of advanced generative models to production.
  • Optimize and fine-tune existing LLMs/generative models through iterative prompt engineering for improved performance, efficiency.
  • Develop LLMOps/CI-CD pipeline for timely deployment of new features and updates.
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand project requirements and translate them into effective generative AI solutions.
  • Drive research initiatives to explore cutting-edge advancements in generative AI
  • Evaluate and integrate relevant AI technologies when applicable, assessing their impact on project objectives.
  • Documentation of models, algorithms, and implementation processes for knowledge sharing and future reference

Skills Required

  • Experience in data extraction/transformation techniques using OCRs, Website crawlers and document extractors from websites, social media platforms, PDFs, images, etc.
  • Strong foundation of NLP, with robust knowledge of Large Language Models (LLM) and Small Language Models (SLM)
  • In depth understanding of RAG (Vector DB, Knowledge Graph) architecture and Agent Based Framework
  • Proficient in Prompt engineering techniques (Zero-shot prompting, Chain-of-thought prompts, Contextual augmentation, Human-in-the-loop)
  • Understanding of foundational deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, huggingface, etc
  • Hands on experience with Cloud AI/Cognitive services (preferably Azure) for text/audio/image/video modalities.
  • Proficiency in Python, Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), API Development (Fast/Rest), Pyspark and Git.
  • Nice to have experience in low code UI platform like Streamlit, Gradio, Chainlit for quick POCs
  • Good in communication and collaboration skills

Title: Lead Machine Learning Ops Engineer â€“ Banking Client â€“ Brussels
Description:
Lead Machine Learning Ops Engineer â€“ Banking Client â€“ Brussels

Duration: 1 year freelance

Rate: Flexible

Remote Working

My Banking Client in looking for an exceptional ML Ops Engineer on a freelance contract.

Qualifications

You have a proven track record of hands-on experience in the area of AI/ML/Advanced Analytics, with special focus on deploying and maintaining AI/ML models and services in production.
Keywords: AI/ML application development, testing, serving, monitoring, troubleshooting.
You know how to ensure ML models are reproducible and interpretable.
You have already single-handedly packaged and deployed AI/ML services to production.
You know how to monitor and maintain AI/ML services post-deployment.
You are proficient in Python
You have 5+ years of work experience with Python, and AI/ML standard libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, xgboost
Nice-to-haves:
Data processing libraries and frameworks (pydantic, pandera)
Web frameworks (such as FastAPI, Flask, ...)
CLI frameworks (Typer, Click, ...)
General MLOps tools and frameworks (MLFlow, Azure ML Studio, ...)
Version control tools for ML datasets and models (DVC, Azure ML Dataset, ...)
Monitoring libraries and solutions (such as NannyML, Evidently AI, ...)
Distributed processing libraries and frameworks (such as Ray, Dask, PySpark, ...)
Pipeline-building and orchestration libraries (such as Metaflow, ZenML, Kedro, Airflow, Dagster, ...)
General Python development tool (pytest, coverage, tox, mypy, black, ruff, uv, pip-compile, ...)
You can write both object-oriented and functional code, and understand concepts such as (de)coupling, coherence, inheritance, composition.
You make sure the code that you and your colleagues write is thoroughly tested (unit, integration, end-to-end, stress/performance).
You love and regularly use data validation and type hints.
You know how to turn a messy jupyter notebook into a production-grade piece of code.
Although we'll apply all possible preventive measure to prevent this from ever happening.
You know how to package a python application or library for distribution
You are a proficient GIT user, able to collaborate with multiple developers on multiple repositories, while following best practices related to branching, merging and code reviews.
You have a good understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and their applications in NLP.
You have work experience with at least one Cloud Provider, preferably Azure Cloud.
You have experience with Unix/Linux command line tools and scripting (shell, bash):
VIP club membership if you have at least once ran `rm -rf` on production data.
You possess the foundational Data Engineering skills, allowing you to interact with the Data Engineering team, and analyze and troubleshoot data pipelines if needed:
You could handle using SQL to extract, transform and load data (ETL/ELT).
Experience with the Hadoop ecosystem (Spark, Kafka, Hive, Impalaâ€¦) is a plus.
Experience with the Cloudera distribution is an additional plus
You understand the modern MLOps framework and complexities it adds to DevOps.
You are able to identify the MLOps maturity gaps and provide inputs for modernization efforts.

Non-technical

You have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as good customer relationship skills to present complex concepts and/or the results of a use case to different audiences (from end users up to division management).
You have experience of working in large, complex enterprises and have stoically accepted it as your fate.
You are not allergic to legacy technology, yet are always on the lookout for modernization opportunities.
You stay up-to-date with new tools, technologies and approaches within the domain.
You are a well-integrated team player.
You are able to estimate your short-term effort with reasonable accuracy and get the work done in the time frame you commit to.
You successfully swim in the waters of Agile project management techniques (scrum boards, standups, demos, reviews).
You stand to promote MLOps and advocate for its usage and necessity across the organization.
Must love mentoring and sharing knowledge.
Must love dad jokes.

Candidates must be based in either Belgium, France, The Netherlands or the UK (IR35 check needed).

Your formal qualifications are the following:

University degree in software engineering OR Data Science/Machine Learning/Data Engineering OR a related quantitative field, combined with strong IT skills.
5+ years of experience with Python
2+ years of experience of using DevOps/CI/CD practices.
2+ years of experience in deploying AI solutions to production.




Please do send across to me the most up to date CV to eobiechefu@welovesalt.com

Title: Internship Data Science
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protecting in the building sector and transportation industry. More than 33,000 employees across 103 countries generated annual sales of CHF 10.5 billion in 2022.

Job Description

Are you a student or a fresh gruadate and interested to gain some practical experience in the field of Data Science? We are offering an interesting 6 months internship starting in September that can provide you just that! For this position you can either be based in Zurich or in Sarnen- depending on your preference. Just be aware that, if based in Zurich, you will have to travel to Sarnen occasionally.

What can you expect? Here is a selection of example assignments:


Analyzing thermoplastic membrane aging along historical and simulated weather data
Image analysis of UV exposed membrane and pattern recognition for micro-cracks
OCR and NLP for location and product information extraction from project documentations


What do we offer?


Dynamic and fun team
Multicultiral environment
Working with senior tech leads both chemical and machine learning domain
Visibility to management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)


Qualifications

Basic understanding of:


At least one programming/scripting language
Database technologies and a query language


Soft Skills


Willingness to learn
Enjoyment of problem solving
English language is needed, German knowledge is advantage


Additional Information


Trust is the foundation of everything we do at Sika: we trust in the competence and capabilities of all our employees â€“ every day.
Built on a foundation of pioneering and entrepreneurial spirit, Sika empowers its people to propose and develop new ideas.
For such a large company, we have a surprisingly flat hierarchy with direct decision-making processes and decentralized organizational units.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Duferco is a global company with diverse interests in energy retail and trading, steel manufacturing, and logistics, where innovation has played a pivotal role in our past successes and now drives our future strategies. Our dedicated Corporate Innovation Team is focused on exploring, nurturing, and implementing innovative ideas, technologies, and strategies to propel our organization to new heights. While operating with the agility of startups, this team maintains a corporate vision and takes the lead in recognizing and capitalizing on opportunities for growth, efficiency, and competitiveness.

As we continue to expand and diversify our operations, we are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. Your role will be pivotal in advancing our mission of using advanced analytics and machine learning models to drive excellence across our diverse portfolio of businesses. If you have a genuine passion for pushing the boundaries of applied data science, acting swiftly, and exploring technologies that can make a substantial impact on our business, we eagerly await your application.




Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and optimize data science solutions for several applications, ranging from industrial manufacturing to energy retail and trading.
Ensure the robustness, scalability, and peak efficiency of deployed models in production environments.
Dedicate time to understand our business needs and collect feedback from the field to empower data science solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven solutions into existing systems and processes or help define new ones.
Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to train and validate AI models.
Ensure the delivery of solutions that are accurate and demonstrate high attention to detail.
Proactively scout and evaluate emerging technologies that can be leveraged within our company's operations.




Qualifications:

A Master's degree with some years of working experience, or a Ph.D., in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with Python and open-source data science and machine learning frameworks and libraries.
Experience handling structured and unstructured data, data pipelines, ETL, and data organization in databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
Familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques (nice-to-have).
Familiarity with mathematical programming and optimization techniques (nice-to-have).
Experience in crafting end-to-end data-driven solutions.




How to Apply:

If you are a proficient Data Scientist with a track record of successful projects, contributions to open-source library development, competition participation, or personal projects, we encourage you to seize this opportunity. Please share your resume, relevant publications, or project portfolios: hr.ch@duferco.com. Only suitable profiles will be contacted.

  • Hands-on experience with Python and open-source data science and machine learning frameworks and libraries.
  • Experience handling structured and unstructured data, data pipelines, ETL, and data organization in databases, data warehouses, and data lakes.
  • Familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques (nice-to-have).
  • Familiarity with mathematical programming and optimization techniques (nice-to-have).
  • Experience in crafting end-to-end data-driven solutions.


How to Apply:

If you are a proficient Data Scientist with a track record of successful projects, contributions to open-source library development, competition participation, or personal projects, we encourage you to seize this opportunity. Please share your resume, relevant publications, or project portfolios: hr.ch@duferco.com. Only suitable profiles will be contacted.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We use a modern stack of:


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.

Particularly, you will get to:


Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.



In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer

On behalf of our Pharmaceutical client in Basel, we are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer with experience in machine learning or MLOps, ideally within the life sciences domain, to support the development of data-driven solutions.
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from the perspective of an engineer is required.

This role requires good skills in software development and team working.

The perfect candidate:

Strong Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.
REST API Design: Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
CI/CD and DevOps: Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces is a plus.
High-Performance Computing: Prior experience working in HPC environments is beneficial.


General Information:

* Start date: 15.8.2024
* Planned duration: 6 months
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Basel
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office:partial


Tasks & Responsibilities:

* Provide agile software development services for the "Target Evaluator" project according to the project plan
* Provide technical consulting services to support the project team


Must Haves:

* Educational background: Bachelor or higher education
* Professional background in a similar role: around 5 years experience
* IT skills: Python, CI/CD, REST API design, ML engineering
* Language skills: English fluent


Nice to Have:

* ML engineering
* experience in high performance computing
* user interface design

If this job interests you please do send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be an expert in optimization/operational-research and high-performance, with the ability to address complex business problems using mathematical optimization or machine learning techniques. They will play a crucial role in translating business challenges into mathematical optimization problems and then developing innovative computational solutions. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Identify and articulate business problems that can be addressed through optimization, by collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Develop and implement mathematical models to optimize business processes and decision-making.
Develop and implement computational efficient solutions.
When necessary, utilize high-performance computing infrastructures to analyze and solve optimization problems efficiently.
While not mandatory, familiarity with quantum computing is a plus, as the candidate should be capable of understanding and modeling problems in a compatible "canonic" form â€“ to make the solutions quantum ready, when relevant.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services (on topics such as advanced pricing, underwriting, reserving, or reinsurance) will be considered highly valuable.







Qualifications:

Advanced degree in optimization, operational-research, mathematics, computer science, or a related field OR an actuarial degree.
Proven experience in applying optimization and operational research techniques to real-world business challenges.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++ or Cuda, but also Python.
Flexibility and Growth Mindset: We are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Scientist (6033)
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.




Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.




Data Scientist (6-month contract - Basel, CH)




About the Role:

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.




Key Responsibilities:

Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.




Requirements:

At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.




Desirable Additional Skills:

Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.




Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Decarbonising Real Estate - â‚£110k + Shares - Brilliant Climate-Tech Start-Up - Hybrid




One of Europe's most innovative Climate-Tech Start-Ups (Winner of the 2024 Tech of the Year Award) has created groundbreaking technology to move beyond the era of dirty buildings and bring Net Zero Real Estate closer to reality.




We are looking for a tech-passionate & bright Machine Learning Engineer who wants to put their skills towards addressing climate change & making a big difference. A team of some of the brightest minds in Europe, from 9 different countries, we embrace a fantastic culture and truly value hard work.




We are a fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate - with backing from world-leading Climate-Tech VC's and Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco â€“ fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt).




What you'll do:




Participate in the enhancement of our decision-making models.
Create and design predictive models for constructing signals.
Conceive new methods for extracting and combining publicly accessible data. Guide the product's direction and data partnerships.
Devise innovative solutions to address our customers' issues.
Manage the entire development process: from specifications to production implementation. Work with colleagues on architecture, design, and code reviews.




Who we are seeking:




Highly Self-Motivated: You can efficiently and promptly carry out tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.
You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum, while delivering quality results.
Lateral thinker: You regularly step back to look at the broader picture. Changing the problem is sometimes faster and better than investing two weeks in a fancy ML model.
Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.
Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.




Essential requirements:




MSc in Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent.
Broad algorithmic knowledge: dynamic programming, graphs algorithms, data structures, etc.
Broad ML knowledge: convex optimization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, etc. Outstanding programming skills (Python, C++, C).
Ability to contribute individually and in teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we canâ€™t support non-EU).




Desirable qualifications




2+ years of professional experience in software development or data science.
Broad financial/real estate knowledge.
Experience with cloud products (GCP or AWS).




Benefits:




Significant impact on the product and strategy from the start.
Continuous learning opportunities in a growth-focused culture.
CHF 1k learning and development budget for conferences and certifications.
100% coverage of non-occupational accident insurance (UVG).
25 days of paid vacation and flexible parental leave.
Mainly based in our ZÃ¼rich office, with some remote work and flexible hours available.




Venchr is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on their talent, skillset and individual merit alone.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
(Permanent, Zurich)




For one of our clients in Zurich, we are looking for a Data Scientist. The right candidate will be responsible for the further development and setup of data, analytics, ML/AI use cases from ideation, business analysis, prototype development to go-live.

The team is growing and is shaping their future of advanced data analysis and AI use cases (machine learning, NLP/LLM, computer vision, etc.) and makes them usable for their business.




Responsibilities:

Oversee the lifecycle of data products: requirement gathering, data engineering, ML/DL training/testing, result visualisation, and operationalisation.
Extract insights from business data using advanced analytics.
Develop data-driven models in NLP, computer vision, ML, and deep learning to address business questions.
Support business stakeholders in data and analytics projects, from ideation to scalable ML/AI solution implementation.
Collaborate closely with Group IT teams.




Requirements:

Degree in computer science, business informatics, statistics, or related field.
Experience with financial, project, and IoT data.
Proficiency in Python and ML/DL libraries.
Knowledge of cloud-based data analytics platforms, preferably Microsoft Azure.
Understanding of microservice architectures and container technologies (e.g., Docker).
Familiarity with agile development, integration technologies, and DevOps practices.
Strong communication skills, initiative, team orientation, and creativity.
Excellent German and English skills.




If you are interested, please apply with your updated CV for a discussion.

Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

  • Understanding of the drug discovery and development process
  • Experience working in the field of Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases
  • Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g. high-performance computing or Spark),
  • Statistical and machine learning, and / or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
  • Experience in using the Foundry platform for data analysis

Requirements:

Start: 01.08.2024

Duration: 5 months

Capacity: 5 days per week

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist




DXT Commodities, for its Lugano office, is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join the Power Analytics team, as a part of the European Power Trading desk. The team mission is the application of advanced statistical and quantitative methodologies to extract value from various and extra-large data sets.

We are searching for a person passionate about quantitative problem solving and keen to explore business implications through continuous interactions within the team.

If you are looking for a challenge in your next career step, this is a truly exciting opportunity for you to apply your advanced statistical skills in our dynamic and exciting team.




Main responsibilities:

The statistical problems to solve will require exposure to multivariate time series and functional data analysis with particular focus on bottom-up physics augmented machine learning algorithms.

The successful applicant will develop, maintain, and improve forecasting models to provide quantitative support to traders.




Requirements:

Strong academic background in STEM fields.
At least three years of combined post-graduate research/professional experience in developing statistical models with a verifiable track record of contributions
Proficiency in Python (R, MLOP and code versioning nice to have)
Willingness to keep up with machine learning and AI advances
Fluency in English, a second European language is a plus




Offer:

Permanent position with very attractive remuneration package
Young, dynamic and highly skilled professional environment




About DXT Commodities:

DXT Commodities SA is an international commodities trading company, active in the European wholesale power and natural gas markets and leader in the offtake of renewable energy, with over 3.5 GW of installed capacity managed.

Please send your CV together with a cover letter to: hr.datanalysis@dxtcommodities.com

Only suitable profiles will be contacted.

By submitting your application you consent to the processing of your personal data by DXT Commodities SA as per the applicable privacy laws and regulations and agree that your data shall be held for the retention period specified in the relevant data protection laws.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
One of our major clients, are looking for a Data Scientist (Biostatistician) to work alongside quantitative scientists, domain experts and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions, and to help our users to apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that deliver impact on research and drug development programs.

We are looking for data scientist bringing expertise in one or more of the following areas:

Cardiovascular
Renal




Responsibilities:

Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.




Requirements:

Master, or PhD in a quantitative / computational science (e.g. bioinformatics, machine learning, statistics, physics, mathematics, ...),
Strong experience with Python for data analysis (scikit-learn, numpy, â€¦),
Experience with R for data analysis (tidyverse, mlr, ...) would be an advantage.




To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience to jtoma@actalentservices.com

Title: AI Engineer (LLM) (100% remote - Europe)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally Masters in Machine learning in computer science.
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python, C++, JavaScript or similar.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientists at QuantCo will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.

We are looking for team players who have excellent quantitative abilities and:


A degree in economics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, or similar fields
In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques and a proven interest in causal inference questions, e.g., A/B tests
Experience in coding and working with data (from a previous research or industry internship or extensive course projects) using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git
Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see
High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism
Business proficiency in German



Bonus if skilled in any of the following tools and/or languages:


SQL
Tensorflow
Keras
Cloud infrastructure
Docker
Lower-level languages like C#/C++/C



What We Offer

You will be part of a smart, motivated, and driven team that revels in working on challenging problems and finding novel solutions; values our customers and users; and strives to deliver thoughtful and impactful products. You will be surrounded by people that respect each other and the contributions each of us brings. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, stock options, and relocation support along with additional location-based benefits.

About QuantCo

At QuantCo, we leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 180 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience. We are globally distributed with offices in Berlin, Boston, Cologne, Karlsruhe, London, Munich, San Francisco, and Zurich.

Our solutions include algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting systems. Our customers include some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the US and Europe. We impact core business processes and decisions by combining advanced data-driven insights with scalable engineering solutions.

We are excited about writing mission-critical code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.

QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Data Scientist / Large Language Model (LLM) Specialist
Description:
We are in search of a talented researcher/machine learning specialist to join our team as a Data Scientist with a focus on Large Language Models (LLM). The ideal candidate will possess a high level of proficiency in data science and demonstrate a strong emphasis on leveraging large language models. This person should have a deep technical understanding of machine learning, complemented by solid programming skills. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn. Be ready to regularly learn new things (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.







Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement cutting-edge machine learning algorithms and models, with a specific emphasis on large language models incl. agents, fine-tuning, new transformers-based architectures.
Stay updated and share advancement on the state of the art.
Participate in local academic partnerships, and ideally develop and drive them.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to (a) share expertise and advice, and (b) implement some of the advanced solutions developed to solve complex business challenges.
More generally, contribute to the innovation and advancement of machine learning capabilities within the organization.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services will be considered a valuable asset.







Qualifications:

A solid background as a researcher and/or data scientist, or a strong interest in technical excellence and machine learning innovation.
In-depth knowledge of machine learning, deep learning and data science is mandatory. In-depth knowledge of natural language processing and in particular large language models is highly appreciated.
Exposure to the LLMâ€™s ecosystem and associated frameworks.
Proficiency of Python, Jupyter Notebook and popular neural network frameworks (Tensorflow and/or PyTorch), along with a good understanding of software engineering principles.
Experience in training Machine Learning models on large data sets.
Open to continuous improvement of Data Science skills: we are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Team player, fruitful interactions with the other team members and external stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.

Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.

Data Scientist (6-month contract)

About The Role

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.

Key Responsibilities


Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.


Requirements


At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


Desirable Additional Skills


Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.


Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com
Show more

  • Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
  • Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
  • Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
  • Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Desirable Additional Skills

  • Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
  • Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
  • Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
  • Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
  • Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
  • Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
  • Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.

Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com
