Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About TSG

Technology Staffing Group SA is a Swiss IT consulting group based in Geneva. Expertise in hiring IT talents as well as co-leading projects for our clients which include start-ups to Fortune 500 companies that are based across Europe. Today, more than 100 employees across Europe support our clients in accelerating and transforming their organizations.

We are seeking Senior and Junior Data Scientists to join our clients' team, focusing on the healthcare sector. These roles offer an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.

Position


Data Scientist



Experience Required


Minimum 2 years of experience in business analysis, focusing on advanced data analytics projects
Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in data mining using statistical tools such as SAS or R
Minimum 2 years of experience in developing machine learning and deep learning algorithms
Minimum 2 years of experience in data warehouse modeling
Minimum 2 years of experience with NoSQL databases, preferably MongoDB
Demonstrated experience in Python application development with at least 2 projects



Main Responsibilities


Apply expertise in business analysis to understand and analyze complex business problems, and translate them into data science solutions
Utilize statistical tools such as SAS or R for data mining, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling to extract actionable insights from large datasets
Develop and deploy machine learning and deep learning algorithms to solve business problems and optimize processes
Design and optimize data warehouse models for efficient data storage and retrieval
Utilize NoSQL databases, particularly MongoDB, for managing and analyzing large-scale data sets
Develop and maintain Python-based applications for data manipulation, analysis, and visualization
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs, provide analytical support, and present findings in a clear and compelling manner



Education/Certification


Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.



Languages


French: Native/Fluent
English: Fluent



Next steps


Our team of recruitment managers is your first point of contact. Their role is to understand your background, to consider your life project and your expectations to offer you missions that suit you.
Depending on your area of expertise, we offer the opportunity to discuss technical topics with one of our colleagues.
Context, constitution of the team in place, objectives, technical expertise requested, challenges to be met: this interview with a Business Manager allows you to better know the assignment or projects on which we could be required to work together.
You will finally have interviews with our clients to meet your future teammates and better understand your work assignment environment.
Your profile is accepted by one of our clients? Congrats and welcome to the TSG community!



Your personal data


By submitting your resume, you accept that the data entered will be retained, reused by TSG to contact you and shared with our clients in the context of your request.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

â€¢ Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

â€¢ Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

â€¢ Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

â€¢ Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

â€¢ Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

â€¢ Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

â€¢ Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

â€¢ Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

â€¢ Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

â€¢ Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

â€¢ Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

â€¢ Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

â€¢ Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

â€¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

â€¢ Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

â€¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills.

â€¢ Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

â€¢ Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

â€¢ Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

â€¢ Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

â€¢ Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Title: ML Engineer/Python Developer
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in drug discovery and development and a leader in personalized healthcare. As the worldâ€™s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they operate in numerous drug discovery and therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.

For their headquarters in Basel, we are currently looking for a Python Developer and a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.

About The Role

We are seeking two highly skilled professionals to join an innovative project that aims to integrate open-source multi-agent systems into a comprehensive, unbiased ranking framework for new drug target proposals.

Responsibilities


Provide agile software development services in line with the project plan
Offer technical consulting services to support the project team
Design and implement RESTful APIs
Utilize Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services
Integrate selected open-source multi-agent systems towards a ranking framework for drug target proposals
(Optional) Assist with the implementation of user interfaces
(Optional) Work within high-performance computing environments


Required Qualifications


Educational background: Bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Approximately 5 years of professional experience in a similar role
Proficiency in Python with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
Experience with CI/CD processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in machine learning engineering or MLOps, especially within the life sciences domain
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from an engineering perspective (required for ML Engineer)
Experience working in HPC environments
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces


Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please, get in contact with us: you may either use the 'apply now' button, or write an email to us, or reach out to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more
HTML:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:

  • Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
  • Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
  • A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
  • Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
  • Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
  • Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: ML Engineer/Python Developer (6019)
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in drug discovery and development and a leader in personalized healthcare. As the worldâ€™s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they operate in numerous drug discovery and therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.

For their headquarters in Basel, we are currently looking for a Python Developer and a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.

About The Role

We are seeking two highly skilled professionals to join an innovative project that aims to integrate open-source multi-agent systems into a comprehensive, unbiased ranking framework for new drug target proposals.

Responsibilities


Provide agile software development services in line with the project plan
Offer technical consulting services to support the project team
Design and implement RESTful APIs
Utilize Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services
Integrate selected open-source multi-agent systems towards a ranking framework for drug target proposals
(Optional) Assist with the implementation of user interfaces
(Optional) Work within high-performance computing environments

Approximately 5 years of professional experience in a similar role
Proficiency in Python with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
Experience with CI/CD processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in machine learning engineering or MLOps, especially within the life sciences domain
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from an engineering perspective (required for ML Engineer)
Experience working in HPC environments
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces

Title: Senior Data Scientist - R Programmer - 5967 URA
Description:
SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R PROGRAMMER â€“ 5967 URA

Our client, an innovative and dynamic bio-pharmaceutical company headquartered in Switzerland, covering multiple therapeutic areas, committed into delivering products on the market over the next 5 years, is looking a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST R- Programmer for a 12 months contract (extendable) based in Basel.




Main Responsibilities:

Support statistics, programming and data management groups across Biometry to explore, review, understand and explain clinical data.
Oversee the creation of customized applications to allow dynamic exploration of clinical trial data and results at critical study milestones (especially following major database locks).
Use and promote reproducible research methods to ensure reports may be refreshed efficiently as data is updated.
Communicate results and educate others through insightful visualizations, reports, publications and presentations.
Create outputs that may be used for publication, regulatory submissions, internal decision-making, market tracking, or other uses.
Support statisticians with ad-hoc exploratory analyses following key database locks.
Champion new ways of working with and presenting clinical data and develop educational material to lead the adoption of these methods across Biometry.
Support data-monitoring initiatives including risk-based monitoring by preparing & sharing outputs /reports to Clinical Trial Teams.
Utilize a diverse array of data mining, analytics and modeling techniques to generate and test working hypotheses, deliver insights and support actionable recommendations to Clinical Teams.
Proactively search for trends in clinical data of ongoing studies, including deviations from assumptions.
Lead development of in-house R packages.
Monitor trends in usage of new technologies across the industry with a critical eye.
Contribute/review new standards, policies, templates and procedures.
Ensure processes are followed as defined in quality documents.
Ensure standards for documents, metadata and data are created, maintained and applied.




Qualifications and Experience:

Relevant Swiss working/residency permit and/or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required;
Masterâ€™s degree in the field of computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, with at least 5 years of relevant programming experience, of which at least 3 within a pharmaceutical company or a clinical research organization (CRO).
Experience extracting, cleaning, preparing, modeling and visualizing data; advanced knowledge of one or more statistical programming languages such as R, SAS, Python, Julia;
Advanced knowledge of R packages such as dplyr for data manipulation and ggplot2 for plotting.
Familiar with generation of interactive reports/dashboards, e.g., R Shiny, Dash, Spotfire, Tableau, QlikSense.
Extensive experience with creating reproducible reports through code versioning using RMarkdown or Notebooks.
Excellent knowledge of processes related to statistical analyses in clinical trials.
Knowledge and understanding of CDISC, especially SDTM and ADaM.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, ability to manage/prioritize multiple projects.
Entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to spot trends, teach others and willingness to learn new techniques.
Must be able to work according to operating procedures, specifications and timelines.
Knowledge of international clinical research regulations and requirements (ICH-GCP) and 21 CFR Part 11.
Excellent presentation, interpersonal skills, and a positive communication style.

Title: Data Scientist (6033)
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services. We support candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programs.

Our client is a leading global player in the pharmaceutical industry with headquarters in Basel, Switzerland. They focus on novel therapies in Oncology and Ophthalmology, and are developing a world-leading pipeline in Neuroscience and Dermatology, boasting one of the strongest Phase II/III pipelines globally.

Data Scientist (6-month contract)

About The Role

The Data Scientist will work with quantitative scientists, domain experts, and product developers to ensure teams succeed in answering scientific questions using the client's platform. They will apply and develop analytical methods and predictive models that impact research and drug development programs, and collaborate on analytical pipelines that can be reused across the platform. They will also advocate for good data science practices and contribute to the design of the platform, making it accessible and useful for the data science and AI community.

Key Responsibilities


Enable and support scientific teams to achieve their goals using the client's platform.
Accelerate data science through the development of reusable pipelines for data preparation and analysis.
Develop frameworks for generating and reporting key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with data scientist users.
Apply expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization, and structured/unstructured data analytics to achieve scientific goals.
Advocate for good data science practices.


Requirements


At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector.
Experience with bioinformatics (DNA/RNA/proteomics data analysis), statistical genetics, and/or biostatistics.
Strong experience with R or Python for data analysis and statistical modeling.
Experience using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data.
Experience with AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data science-related processes.
Familiarity with principles and tools of good data science practices (e.g., Git/versioning).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.


Desirable Additional Skills


Knowledge of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADaM).
Experience with pooling clinical trial data.
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process.
Experience in Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases.
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g., high-performance computing or Spark).
Statistical and machine learning, and/or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience using the Foundry platform for data analysis.


Would you like to learn more about CTC and this opportunity? Please contact us by using the 'apply now' button or write an email to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: Data Science Internship (6 months)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Data Science Internship (6 months) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for a Data Science Trainee for 6 months to join our Technology and Innovation team in the Research and Development function in Oberwinterthur, Switzerland.

You will be part of our R&D organization and experience the development of new products from the ideation phase to market-ready products for our Separation Technology business unit. The focus for this position will be on our digitalization initiative. You will work with a dynamic and innovative team to support data-driven product development.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Building workflows to capture and structure data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Statistical and machine-learning-assisted analyses of the data to identify critical parameters and optimize product development.
Implement new analytical technologies to further enhance our digitalization efforts.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


We look for excellent students in Chemical, Process or Mechanical Engineering (or related fields).
Strong data science experience in areas including statistical modeling, data mining, data visualization and data-driven analyses.
Proficiency in a programming language such as Python or R.
Knowledge of databases and data pipelines.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Ability to co-ordinate and prioritize various tasks.
Driven, innovative and curious mindset.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (inclusive of bank holidays) + service days
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

To complete your application, we kindly ask you to include your CV and other supporting documentation, such as academic transcripts, and, if available, written references.

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning, Gemini
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.


Preferred qualifications:


PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).
Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
Excellent data analysis skills.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.

In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.

A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Research teams to understand technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.
Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more
HTML:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
  • 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
  • 2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, or natural language processing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD in Machine Learning or a related field.
  • Experience with Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
  • Experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs).
  • Ability to grow under pressure in high-stakes, high-visibility environments.
  • Excellent data analysis skills.

About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The team is working on all Multimodal efforts across Gemini. We launched image retrieval, image understanding and generation. This includes a significant amount of deep modeling such as Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and iterative process optimization (IPO) establishing data flywheel, etc. Part of the team is also involved in building necessary infrastructure and landing multimodal model capabilities and features.

In this role, you will have significant external impact, offering tremendous potential for growth and increased responsibility.

A conversational AI tool that enables users to collaborate with generative AI and help augment their imagination, expand their curiosity, and enhance their productivity.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Research teams to understand technologies, adapting and integrating them into Gemini/Bard to drive continuous improvement.
  • Leverage Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF), and Preference Optimization (IPO) to quality hill climb.
  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover insights, pinpoint opportunities, and inform the strategic development of a data flywheel.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/w/d) (80-100%)
Description:
At Accelleron, we go further. Building on the heritage of more than 100 years as ABB Turbocharging, you will join a team of true experts in an exciting international environment that share a commitment to excel, to be a trusted partner in supporting our customers in the gradual change towards sustainable industries with innovative technology, expertise and smart solutions. We are driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions as we welcome and celebrate individual differences.







Job description

Within the Digital Division of Accelleron, we are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed AI team and contribute to the development of AI/ML-driven initiatives. As ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in setting up and maintaining cloud infrastructure to facilitate model training, deployment, and lifecycle management. Your duties will involve a combination of hands-on coding, infrastructure setup, and collaboration with data scientists to support the development of cutting-edge machine learning solutions for use in our digital customer solutions and business services.




We are open for international applications with possibility to be hired in country youâ€™re based in!







Your responsibilities:

Work closely with, and support data scientists in bringing blue-print models to production by writing clean and maintainable Python code, leveraging frameworks such as PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.
Spearhead the integration of pioneering neural network architectures into value-adding machine learning projects, fostering a culture of innovation within the team and continually pushing the boundaries of model performance and capability.
Ensure proper model deployment and lifecycle on our Azure infrastructure, setting up and managing cloud resources as necessary to ensure scalability and robustness.
Collaborate closely with both business stakeholders and experts on turbocharging to translate project requirements into value-adding machine learning solutions.







Your background:

Proven experience (3+ years) working as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role in a professional setting.
Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure.
Proficiency in Python programming language and experience with machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Experience in SQL.
Strong knowledge of software development best practices including version control, code reviews, and automated testing.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.










Your benefits:

Attractive compensation & benefits
Employee Assistance Program
Remote Work Policy
Global parental leave program
Flexible working models







We look forward to receiving your application. If you want to discover more about Accelleron, take another look at our website accelleron-industries.com.




Accelleron Data Privacy Statement: accelleron-industries.com/privacy-notice/candidate

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for an R&D environment where you can work with world-class scientists and engineers on cutting edge projects? Do you want to contribute to a better world while building a career? Do you also have a passion for science, engineering, technology, business, data and human creativity?

You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Data Scientists and Engineers working on solving interesting, real-world problems that truly make a difference. Your main responsibilities will be to deliver value for clients in the Nordics. Supported by our global knowledge base and network of skilled colleagues, you will be part of strategic discussions and contribute to solutioning.

Requirements For The Role


Masters or PhD in a scientific field (computer science, mathematics, biology, engineering etc.)
A minimum of 5 years of relevant academic or professional experience within data engineering and data science
An analytical mindset, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and solve hands-on technical challenges
Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts
Experience in one or several object-oriented scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of cloud platforms, tools and services provided by AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
Understanding how to implement effective ETL steps on said platforms
Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and written
Be an EU citizen or hold a work permit


Meritorious Skills


5+ years of professional experience
Business analysis and tech project management skills are an advantage
Working knowledge of databases, SQL and/or Elasticsearch, and experience with data management tools such as Databricks.
Experience implementing data pipelines using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Knime (or similar)


What We Offer

Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies.

We offer you a work environment branded by innovation. You will be working with the cutting edge of IT and technology, surrounded by dedicated and skilled colleagues with high expertise.

As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will belong in a global professional community with well formed career paths, trainings and opportunities for mentorship and continuous competence development opportunities.

Join us and Get The Future You Want!

Welcome with your application!

Duration: Contract

5+ years of hands-on Python and R development experience with excellent programming skills
3+ years of experience with cloud-based platform, ideally Microsoft Azure
working experience and skills on big data technologies such as PySpark, Databricks, Kafka, Strong solution design skills, able to work independently as well as mentor junior developers
Good SQL skills, with hands-on experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, Oracle, Good understanding and hands-on experience on Object-Oriented analysis and design
Familiar with agile software development methodology
Familiar with effective testing frameworks such as BDD, bachelor's (or above) degree in computer science or other relevant technical disciplines
Good communication skills
Experience working in a global teams

Experience and knowledge in investment bank and risk will be a plus
Java knowledge will be a plus

Hi Professionals,


Greetings From Ampstek!!


Hope you are high in your spirits. Please stay safe.


Our client is looking for Python Developer to join a high-growth organization. If you are interested share you resume sudhakaran.m@ampstek.com


Role: Python Developer

Location: Zurich, Switzerland(Onsite 3days/Week)

Duration: Contract


Job Description:


  • 5+ years of hands-on Python and R development experience with excellent programming skills
  • 3+ years of experience with cloud-based platform, ideally Microsoft Azure
  • working experience and skills on big data technologies such as PySpark, Databricks, Kafka, Strong solution design skills, able to work independently as well as mentor junior developers
  • Good SQL skills, with hands-on experience with relational databases such as PostgreSQL, Oracle, Good understanding and hands-on experience on Object-Oriented analysis and design
  • Familiar with agile software development methodology
  • Familiar with effective testing frameworks such as BDD, bachelor's (or above) degree in computer science or other relevant technical disciplines
  • Good communication skills
  • Experience working in a global teams
  • Experience working on data science or machine learning projects will be a plus,
  • Experience and knowledge in investment bank and risk will be a plus
  • Java knowledge will be a plus




Thanks & Regards,

Sudhakaran

IT Recruiter | Europe & UK

Title: Software Engineer III, AI/ML
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
Experience in coding and Machine Learning (ML).
Experience in Computer Vision.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with software development in C++.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Responsibilities


Write product or system development code.
Improve the signals and understand the query of Google Lens.
Develop and evaluate image embedding of lens quality.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Scientist - Pharma, bioinformatics
Description:
Data Scientist requiring profound Pharma and Bioinformatics knowledge vacancy for a globally operating Basel based company in the pharmaceutical sector.

Your Tasks


Supporting scientific teams in achieving their goals
Developing reusable pipelines for data preparation and analyses
Creating frameworks for generating key results and quality benchmarks
Appling machine learning and deep learning expertise to scientific objectives
Advocating for good data science practices


Your Experience/knowledge


2+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Expertise in omics data analysis, Immunology, Cardiology, Renal, Metabolic diseases, or large-scale data computation
Proficiency in R or Python for data analysis and statistical modelling
Experience with machine learning models for predicting clinical endpoints
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
PhD in a quantitative or computational science such as bioinformatics, machine learning or statistics


Location: Basel, Switzerland

Work setting: On-site

Sector: Pharma

Start: ASAP

Duration: 05MM+

Workload: 100%

Ref.Nr.: BH21925

Take the next step and send us your resume along with a daytime phone number where we can reach you.

Due to Swiss work permit restrictions, we can only consider applications from Swiss nationals, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland.

Ukrainian refugees are warmly welcomed, we will support you all the way.

We welcome applications from individuals of all genders, age groups, sexual orientations, personal expressions, ethnic backgrounds, and religious beliefs. Therefore, there is no requirement to provide gender information or a photo in your application.

As per client requirements, we need information about your marital status, nationality, date of birth, and a valid Swiss work permit. For applicants with disabilities, we are happy to explore potential solutions with our end client.

Title: Data scientist
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork â€“ the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Result of Service

The consultant will contribute to the creation of a new global database measuring the perception and relative incidence of various topics in the media.

Work Location

Home-Based

Expected duration

29.07.24 to 15.03.25

Duties And Responsibilities

This position is located in the Office of the Secretary-General of UNCTAD, in the Technical Team of the Global Crisis Response Group. Under the direct supervision of the lead data scientist and the overall supervision of the Senior Coordinator, and within delegated authority, the consultant will be responsible for: - Supporting and furthering the team's existing date projects; - Researching potential future projects, including, but not limited to: the development and creation of a media perception dataset and index, and the creation of economic indicators from satellite imagery and geospatial data; - Identifying trends and patterns in data on the effects of the global crisis on food, energy and finance on the world economy and particularly developing countries; - Assessing the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques; - Developing custom data models, algorithms, and economic models to apply to data sets of the GCRG, and maintaining comprehensive and well-structured documentation of algorithms, models, and code; - Maintaining and organizing the databases needed or generated by the Technical Team.

Qualifications/special Skills

An advanced university degree (Master or equivalent) in economics, statistics, data science or similar field, is required. At least 6 years experience of working with data analysis, economic modelling, or economic analysis in a professional or academic setting is required. Proficiency in a statistical programming language, preferably R, and a data science programming language, preferably Python is required. Additional experience with SQL, Git, R Markdown and Jupyter Lab is desirable.

Languages

Fluency spoken and written in English is required.

Additional Information

Not available.

No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTSâ€™ BANK ACCOUNTS.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

â€¢ Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

â€¢ Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

â€¢ Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

â€¢ Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

â€¢ Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

â€¢ Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

â€¢ Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

â€¢ Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

â€¢ Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

â€¢ Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

â€¢ Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

â€¢ Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

â€¢ Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

â€¢ Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

â€¢ Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

â€¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills.

â€¢ Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

â€¢ Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

â€¢ Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

â€¢ Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

â€¢ Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Title: Senior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
OLSYS provides full-service solutions for mid-market and enterprise organizations.

With 15+ years of experience, 100+ projects, and 50+ strong technical experts in the team, we continue to grow by expanding our development team in Europe, as well as expanding the base of new clients and projects.

As an enterprise software development company, we are building long-term partnerships helping our clients accelerate their digital experiences with reasonable IT investments.

Our tailored approach, e-commerce focus, and flexible solutions allow us to design, develop, and deliver scalable, integrated commerce platforms that drive profits and boost the business.

Our Industry Focus

â€” Banking and Finance (business continuity management, planning system, banking app development);

â€” Retail and E-Commerce (B2B Commerce, B2C Commerce, Digital/E-Commerce customer experience);

â€” Healthcare (website development for Healthcare organizations).

Our Expertise Includes

â€” Commerce Solutions

â€” Development Services

â€” Creative Services

â€” Quality Assurance and Testing

â€” Maintenance and Support

â€” E-Commerce Consulting

The Role

Responsibilities


Interact with the modern LLMs and adopt the best practices of their usage.
R&D activities (experimenting with LLMs): Generate code based on the input description. Build test cases based on the user scenarios.
Performance Monitoring: Monitor the performance of the models and make adjustments as necessary to maintain or enhance model accuracy and efficiency.
Data Preprocessing and Annotation: Work with the Data Engineering team to preprocess and annotate the training data for AI/ML models. Collaborate with subject matter experts to create labeled datasets that facilitate supervised and unsupervised learning.
Prototyping and Evaluation: Rapidly prototype and iterate different AI/ML approaches to identify the most suitable solution to meet the requirements.


Perform rigorous evaluations to measure the model's performance against defined metrics.


Documentation: Document all stages of the AI/ML development process, including design choices, architecture, algorithms, and evaluation results, ensuring knowledge transfer and team understanding.
Collaboration: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Software Engineers.
Stay Abreast of Industry Trends: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, NLP, LLM and other relevant technologies. Integrate new research findings and methodologies into the project as applicable.


Ideal Profile


Experience: Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI, Interactive Chatbots, Graph databases.
Data Processing: Experience in preprocessing and handling large-scale, unstructured text data, and the ability to perform data analysis and validation.
Problem-solving and Innovation: Proven ability to tackle complex technical challenges, think innovatively, and propose creative solutions to real-world problems.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


English level: Upper-Intermediate

What's on Offer?


You can contribute and influence the development of a new product
Work with AI product
Flexible working options

Title: ML Engineer/Python Developer
Description:
The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in drug discovery and development and a leader in personalized healthcare. As the worldâ€™s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they operate in numerous drug discovery and therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.

For their headquarters in Basel, we are currently looking for a Python Developer and a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer on a 6-month contract, with the possibility of extension.

About The Role

We are seeking two highly skilled professionals to join an innovative project that aims to integrate open-source multi-agent systems into a comprehensive, unbiased ranking framework for new drug target proposals.

Responsibilities


Provide agile software development services in line with the project plan
Offer technical consulting services to support the project team
Design and implement RESTful APIs
Utilize Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services
Integrate selected open-source multi-agent systems towards a ranking framework for drug target proposals
(Optional) Assist with the implementation of user interfaces
(Optional) Work within high-performance computing environments


Required Qualifications


Educational background: Bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Approximately 5 years of professional experience in a similar role
Proficiency in Python with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices
Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
Experience with CI/CD processes using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in machine learning engineering or MLOps, especially within the life sciences domain
Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and LLM-based multi-agent frameworks from an engineering perspective (required for ML Engineer)
Experience working in HPC environments
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces


Would you like to learn more about CTC and the opportunity outlined? Please, get in contact with us: you may either use the 'apply now' button, or write an email to us, or reach out to vanessa.gilardoni@ctcresourcing.com

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for an R&D environment where you can work with world-class scientists and engineers on cutting edge projects? Do you want to contribute to a better world while building a career? Do you also have a passion for science, engineering, technology, business, data and human creativity?

You will be part of a diverse and inclusive team of Data Scientists and Engineers working on solving interesting, real-world problems that truly make a difference. Your main responsibilities will be to deliver value for clients in the Nordics. Supported by our global knowledge base and network of skilled colleagues, you will be part of strategic discussions and contribute to solutioning.

Requirements For The Role


Masters or PhD in a scientific field (computer science, mathematics, biology, engineering etc.)
A minimum of 5 years of relevant academic or professional experience within data engineering and data science
An analytical mindset, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and solve hands-on technical challenges
Excellent communication and presentation skills and an ability to explain complex concepts
Experience in one or several object-oriented scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
Knowledge of cloud platforms, tools and services provided by AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
Understanding how to implement effective ETL steps on said platforms
Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and written
Be an EU citizen or hold a work permit


Meritorious Skills


5+ years of professional experience
Business analysis and tech project management skills are an advantage
Working knowledge of databases, SQL and/or Elasticsearch, and experience with data management tools such as Databricks.
Experience implementing data pipelines using tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Knime (or similar)


What We Offer

Capgemini Engineering is one of the world's leading consulting companies in R&D. We work in most industries globally. We deliver, together with our global centers of expertise, solutions for both large global customers and smaller local start-up companies.

We offer you a work environment branded by innovation. You will be working with the cutting edge of IT and technology, surrounded by dedicated and skilled colleagues with high expertise.

As a consultant at Capgemini Engineering, you will belong in a global professional community with well formed career paths, trainings and opportunities for mentorship and continuous competence development opportunities.

Join us and Get The Future You Want!

Welcome with your application!

Title: (Global Oil Gas) Senior Data Scientist
Description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

About the Company



This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.

Job Summary

We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the Sales & Operations Planning Division's (S&OP) under the Global Optimizer Department. S&OP's primary responsibility is to optimize crude allocation and operations across global manufacturing facilities. This optimization aims to maximize revenue, increase profitability, and capitalize on international market opportunities.

The division serves as the gatekeeper for linear programming (LP) at wholly owned refineries and oversees the integrated global MPIMS model. This model is crucial for optimizing global crude allocation, exploring new international markets, and integrating operational options.

As a Data Scientist, your main role will involve analyzing and structuring large volumes of real-time and historical data. You will build algorithms and solutions around this data to facilitate decision-making within the company. Your work will be pivotal in supporting the company's forecasting and predictive digital strategy, contributing to the development of advanced solutions at the Downstream Digital Center.

Key Responsibilities:

Formulate and lead multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data.
Interpret and analyze data using exploratory mathematical and statistical techniques based on the scientific method.
Coordinate research and analytic activities utilizing various data points (unstructured and structured) and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data.
Experiment against data points, provide information based on experiment results, and offer previously undiscovered solutions to complex data challenges.
Lead all data experiments tasked by the Data Science Team.
Coordinate with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Data Analysts, Data Integrators, Knowledge Managers, and Intel Analysts.
Develop methodology and processes for prioritization and scheduling of projects.
Analyze problems and determine root causes.
Define company data assets (data models), Spark, SparkSQL, and HiveSQL jobs to populate data models.
Work closely with all business units and engineering teams to develop strategy for long-term data platform architecture.



Requirements:

Willingness to relocate to Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related fields. An advanced degree is preferred.
Have 5-7 years of professional experience in a related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming languages (Java, C++, Python, R, etc.).
Demonstrate experience applying data science methods to real-world data problems.
Experience in utilizing visualization tools to leverage the growing volume of available information.

Title: Postdoctoral Fellow (m/f/d) Cheminformatics Data Scientist â€“ 2 years
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all â€“ while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

We are currently seeking a 2-year fixed term Postdoctoral Fellowship contract in our chemistry department in Stein AG, Switzerland where you will be given the opportunity to develop new skills while working at the cutting edge of science and innovation. At Syngenta, our work matters; we are looking for the talents of today and tomorrow.

Responsibilities

We are seeking a dynamic individual to join our team and contribute to the enhancement of our High-Throughput Experimentation (HTE) platform through the implementation and integration in our software platform of cutting-edge experimental design algorithms. In this role, you will be responsible for:


Conducting a detailed analysis of existing methodologies for design of experiments, including design of experiments and Bayesian approaches, and providing a comprehensive summary of their features.
Developing a robust Python package that integrates all pertinent existing algorithms, ensuring seamless interaction with our internal reaction data management software platform.
Leveraging large-scale chemical reaction conditions datasets to create machine learning algorithms that enable intelligent selection of variables and their values as input to reaction optimization experimental design
Establishing the groundwork for customizable, on-demand machine learning models for reaction optimization that users can operate independently.
Crafting intuitive graphical user visualizations for straightforward interpretation of results by end-users.


As an integral part of our collaborative team, you will work closely with automation scientists and chemists who are the primary beneficiaries of your work, enhancing the platform through continuous iterative feedback.

You will find your place within a diverse team of Chemists and Computer Scientists, all of whom bring extensive knowledge in cheminformatics and software development.

Our organization is a fervent advocate for open-source software development and encourages the public sharing of our collaborative achievements.

Join us to advance your career and shape the future of experimental design in a stimulating and forward-thinking environment.

Qualifications


PhD in cheminformatics or machine learning
Demonstrated experience in chemical informatics, algorithms, and/or software design
Demonstrated working knowledge and application of statistics and data modeling to large scale life-sciences data.


What We Expect


Strong knowledge in chemical informatics, including methods to manipulate chemical structure information and representations (ideally using RDKit)
Mastering of chemical concepts (structure, reactivity, properties, some knowledge in experimental design is a plus)
Knowledge in programming (python)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques
Skills in data visualization and representation for analytics purposes is a plus
Fluency in spoken and written English language
Be an effective communicator, self-motivated, and able to drive insights into actions


Additional Information

What We Offer


Contribution to valuable and impactful work, in a stimulating environment -> #bringingplantpotentialtolife
Work in interdisciplinary teams
A superb working environment at our Global Research Center in Stein
Scientific and technical excellence
Scientific and technical support, including mentoring and tutoring
Continuous professional development and high scientific standards are foundations of our culture
State-of-the-art tools, access to professional infrastructure


Interested? We are looking for your online application. Please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages. Any applications submitted without a Research Summary will not be subject to further evaluation.

Please be aware that the job title may differ from the position title.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We favor work life balance and enable flexible working.

Title: Software Engineer III, AI/ML
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Bachelorâ€™s degree or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.
Experience in coding and Machine Learning (ML).
Experience in Computer Vision.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience with software development in C++.


About The Job

Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Googleâ€™s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Responsibilities


Write product or system development code.
Improve the signals and understand the query of Google Lens.
Develop and evaluate image embedding of lens quality.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: AI Developer Technology Engineer
Description:
NVIDIA is looking for a passionate, world-class computer scientist to work in its Compute Developer Technology (Devtech) team as an AI Developer Technology Engineer. Artificial intelligence, the dream of computer scientists for over half a century, is no longer science fiction. And in the next few years, it will transform every industry. Soon, self-driving cars will reduce congestion and improve road safety. AI travel agents will know your preferences and arrange every detail of your family vacation. And medical instruments will read and understand patient DNA to detect and treat early signs of cancer. Where engines made us stronger and powered the first industrial revolution, AI will make us smarter and power the next. What will make this intelligent industrial revolution possible? A new computing model â€” GPU deep learning â€” that enables computers to learn from data and write software that is too complex for people to code.

What You Will Be Doing


Optimize Deep Learning Algorithms: Enhance the performance of deep learning algorithms on NVIDIA's GPU platforms to achieve superior efficiency and accuracy.
Customer Implementation Support: Provide expert assistance to key customers, helping them implement and optimize their AI workloads on NVIDIA hardware.
Advance NVIDIA Technologies: Contribute to the development and improvement of NVIDIA's libraries and hardware to meet the computational demands of cutting-edge deep learning applications.
Collaborate with Engineering Teams: Work closely with both internal and external engineering teams to drive innovation and solve complex technical challenges in AI and deep learning.
Contribute to Open Source Frameworks: Actively participate in the development and enhancement of high-performance open source inference frameworks such as TensorRT-LLM, furthering the field of AI acceleration.


What We Need To See


Master's degree or PhD in engineering or computer science, or equivalent experience.
Substantial experience of at least 3 years in relevant work or research.
Proficiency in C/C++, Python, AI algorithms, and software design.
Familiarity with parallel programming, especially CUDA C/C++, preferred.
Effective collaboration and problem-solving skills, with strong communication and organization abilities.
Occasional travel might be required for conferences and on-site visits with developers.


Joining NVIDIA means becoming part of a team of individuals who demonstrate exceptional work behaviors and contribute to shaping the future of AI computing. We take pride in being one of the most desirable employers in the technology industry. Our employees play a pivotal role in driving innovation and ensuring the success of our world-class AI computing platform.

At NVIDIA, we are committed to creating an inclusive and fair workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and greatly appreciate the unique perspectives and talents that individuals bring, regardless of their personal characteristics. Our hiring and promotion practices strictly adhere to anti-discrimination laws, ensuring that race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected characteristic does not influence our decisions.

We are committed to providing equal opportunities for all candidates. If you require any reasonable accommodations or adjustments throughout the application process, please let us know. We are here to ensure that every candidate has an equal opportunity to succeed.

Join our dynamic team and contribute to the implementation of advanced AI solutions in the fast-growing field of parallel computing.

#deeplearning

Title: Data Scientist, Risk
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises â€” including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass â€” use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Weâ€™re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for both internal and external users. We have multiple autonomous and collaborative teams who are eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve how things work. Together, we strive to build robust and scalable systems that enable Brex to grow rapidly and help our customers reach their full potential.

Risk Data Science at Brex

In the Risk Data Science team, we leverage data and AI to manage financial risk (fraud, money laundering, and credit), striking a balance between mitigating those risks and creating a positive experience for our customers.

What Youâ€™ll Do

Our Data Scientists are responsible for the entire model development lifecycle from conception with stakeholders, developing the model in a notebook, putting it into production, and circling back with stakeholders to make product or strategic decisions.

Responsibilities


Drive Data & AI solutions from inception to deployment to efficiently manage risk
Be responsible for the full machine learning lifecycle: data acquisition, model design, training, productionization, and monitoring
Partner with cross-functional teams (Ops, Engineering, Product, Fraud, Compliance and Credit)


Requirements


4+ years of experience in Data Science/ML roles
Expertise with Python programming, SQL queries, and ML-related frameworks
Previous experience in the Risk domain (Fraud, AML, and/or Credit)
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
English proficiency/fluency, both written and speaking (note: interviews will be conducted in English)
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting September 1st, 2025 when we open our Sao Paulo office


Bonus points


Experience working with real-time data sets
Experience in the finance industry


Location


Must be working in Brazil at the start of role


Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Rain

is a venture-backed fintech with a mission to enable billions of people to reach financial freedom. Our first product gives employees instant access to their earned wages, enabling people to start their journey to financial success. Rain is the fastest-growing startup in the category and was incubated with

QED Capital , a top fintech venture fund. We are looking for a

Machine Learning Engineer for a fully remote position. The candidate will work closely with a team of talented engineers and data scientists to design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models. Your expertise will guide the development of complex algorithms that solve real-world problems, driving efficiency and innovation. As a Machine Learning Engineer with Rain, you will play a central role with our US-based product and engineering teams to implement quickly and contribute to all development lifecycle phases. Our ideal candidate is excited to tackle tough technical challenges and is looking for opportunities to contribute to our strategic thinking. Responsibilities: - Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine-learning algorithms and models - Optimize and enhance existing machine learning frameworks and infrastructure for better scalability and efficiency. - Manage different integration types with 3rd-party vendors and partners - Build reusable code and libraries for future use - Optimize Rain application for maximum speed and scalability - Design and implementation of data storage and data integration solutions - Conduct code reviews, ensuring adherence to best practices and quality standards. Requirements: - Proficient in programming languages such as Python or Java, and experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). - Solid understanding of REST API design, development, and security standards (OAuth). - Experience designing and scaling event-driven microservice architectures, using messaging bus/queue technologies such as Kafka and stream processing. - Management of hosting environment, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes. - Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. - Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and best practices. Nice-to-Haves: - Proficient knowledge of back-end programming languages; experience with Go (Golang) - Experience in data pipelines integrating multiple data sources, including data ingestion and transformation. As an equal opportunity employer, Rain is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our people bring our products and organization to life, and every unique perspective makes us better. If you need accommodation in the recruiting process due to a disability, please email ****** or let your recruiter know. Powered by JazzHR
