Title: Data Scientist, Search, Real World Journeys (English, Portuguese)
Description:
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 3 years of work experience with a PhD degree.
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


Preferred qualifications:


8 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 6 years of work experience with a PhD degree.


About The Job

In this role, you will work cross-functionally with multiple tech leads from Engineering, Product and UX to advance our metric capabilities. You will apply advanced modeling techniques (e.g., LLM, Gemini models) for ML based metrics, Human Evaluation methods and design research based on user-survey data. Our responsibilities include metric development, product performance investigation, experiment design, and complex user journey analysis.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities


Partner with Product and Engineering teams of Real World Journeys to provide problem-solving thought leadership, support metrics research and advanced statistical analysis of complex user journeys on search.
Work cross-functionally to identify metric improvement areas, design new metrics and evaluation methods.
Support teams with advanced experimentation methods, detecting user learning effects and driving actionable user insights from A/B testing metrics analysis.
Work with large data sets and solve non-routine investigative issues, use problem-solving and statistical methods to the issues to measure quality, improve consumer products, and understand the behavior of end-users.
Make product recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders, and storytelling with data.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Scientist for Risk and Fraud
Description:
About The Role

Join our team as a Risk Decision Scientist and play a crucial role in safeguarding the integrity of the Uber platform. In this global position, you will leverage your data-driven expertise to identify, analyze, and mitigate emerging fraud trends. Through statistical analysis and creative problem-solving, you will contribute to the development of robust strategies that minimize fraud losses while ensuring operational efficiency and a seamless user experience.

Collaborating with cross-functional teams comprising engineers, product managers, fellow decision scientists, and operations managers, you will be responsible for key performance metrics related to fraud detection and false positives optimization. Your analytical prowess and business acumen will be instrumental in driving data-informed decisions and shaping the future of risk management at Uber.

While experience with machine learning techniques is a valuable asset, this role primarily focuses on statistical analysis, fraud detection, and risk management rather than specific model development or deployment.

What You'll Do


Perform statistical analysis to understand fraud behaviours and contribute to detection models/features
Build and maintain fraud rules to address evolving fraudulent activities
Extract insights from large datasets to develop fraud mitigation strategies
Build deep understanding of risk data, reporting, and key metrics
Conduct experiments to test and optimize risk mitigation solutions
Collaborate with global cross-functional teams on fraud prevention projects
Effectively communicate findings to drive business decisions
With guidance from manager, define and develop an area of expertise


What You'll Need:


Immediate availability to work from SÃ£o Paulo
English proficiency (B2+)
Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data-focused role, such as data science, fraud analytics, risk management, or business intelligence
Exceptional proficiency in SQL and statistical analysis languages (Python, R, or similar)
Proven track record of leveraging advanced analytical techniques and statistical methods to solve complex, real-world problems
Experience in experimentation, A/B testing, and statistical modeling
Expertise in defining, measuring, and communicating performance metrics that drive business impact
Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate technical concepts to diverse stakeholders
A natural problem-solver with a passion for critical thinking and a "get things done" mindset
Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of thriving in a dynamic, self-directed environment


Bonus Points If You have:


Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Economics, or a related discipline
Data engineering/pipeline creation experience
Prior background in risk, fraud, or payments

Title: Data Scientist/ Engineer (English Speaker- Intern)
Description:
The future of insurance starts with AI. To date, Shift Technology's AI-powered products have benefitted more than 300 million policyholders globally by reducing underwriting risk, identifying more fraud, and automating critical tasks throughout the claims process. Shift harnesses the power of AI to enable the worldâ€™s leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products help insurers improve operational efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer experiences to their policyholders. Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 50 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.

The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

Please note that to be eligible for this job YOU should be currently enrolled to a SÃ£o Paulo (Capital) University AND be already on the last year of your studies.

What Youâ€™ll Doâ€¦

As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, you will be able to:


Understand insurance data and fraud mechanisms;
Create the associated mathematical models;
Implement, test and optimize the associated algorithms;
Participate in workshops with the clients to gather feedback and integrate it into the models;
Continuously provide ideas to improve the solution.



What You Bring...


You are native in Portuguese and fluent in English (mandatory)
You have advanced technical skills in Applied Mathematics, preferably in machine learning and/or operations research;
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details;
You can write quality production code;
You are keen to face our clients to discuss their needs and integrate their feedback into your projects;
You can communicate clearly in English and are fluent in another language.



To support our permanent, full time employees at every stage of their careers and lives, we provide a competitive total rewards and benefits package. Here are the global benefits weâ€™d like to highlight:


Flexible remote and hybrid working options
Competitive Salary and a variable component tied to personal and company performance
Company equity
Focus Fridays, a half-day each month to focus on learning and personal growth
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Mental health benefits
2 MAD Days per year (Make A Difference Days for paid volunteering)



Additional benefits may be offered by country - ask your recruiter for more information. Intern and Apprentice position are eligible for some of these benefits - ask your recruiter for more details.

At Shift we strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from and hire people who will contribute to the diversity of our company, without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria.

Shift Technology is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our application and employment process. Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@shift-technology.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Please be aware of scammers and only trust correspondence that comes from emails ending in shift-technology.com

Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Applied AI
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises â€” including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass â€” use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Weâ€™re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for both internal and external users. We have multiple autonomous and collaborative teams who are eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve how things work. Together, we strive to build robust and scalable systems that enable Brex to grow rapidly and help our customers reach their full potential.

Applied AI at Brex

As part of Brexâ€™s AI team, Applied AI leverages cutting-edge AI/ML techniques to empower automation solutions in Brexâ€™s spend management offering, working closely with Product, Design, and Engineering teams.

What Youâ€™ll Do

The Applied AI team drives for a more streamlined experience for our customers via AI/ML automations. We are looking for a strong Data Scientist to join our nimble and effective team. You will be responsible for the full cycle of work from ideation, research, and development to production and further improvements, working both strategically and tactically with cross-functional stakeholders to balance priority and delivery.

Responsibilities


Design and implement spend management related solutions with ML and AI techniques
Partner closely with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to understand their needs and identify opportunities to accelerate the AI/ML development and deployment process
Consult and educate internal teams on current and up-and-coming research, technologies, and best practices of leveraging ML and LLM in product design and development
Work closely with AI Platform engineers to identify upcoming requirements and continuously evolve the AI platform offering


Requirements


4+ years of industry experience developing optimization models that drive business impact
Passion for delivering data-driven solutions leveraging data, ML, and AI
M.S. or PhD. in Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, or other quantitative field
Familiarity with programming languages (e.g. Python) and machine learning libraries (e.g. SciKit Learn)
Deep understanding of natural language processing techniques
Experience in overall big data analysis and system-backed integration with ML/LLM system/solution
Good understanding of quantitative disciplines such as statistics, machine learning, operations research, and causal inference
Experience productionizing and A/B testing different machine learning models
English proficiency/fluency, both written and speaking (note: interviews will be conducted in English)
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting September 1st, 2025 when we open our Sao Paulo office


Bonus points


Experience leveraging commercial or open source LLM APIs to build solutions, such as OpenAI or llama
Experience in the finance industry


Location


Must be working in Brazil at the start of role


Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Rain

is a venture-backed fintech with a mission to enable billions of people to reach financial freedom. Our first product gives employees instant access to their earned wages, enabling people to start their journey to financial success. Rain is the fastest-growing startup in the category and was incubated with

QED Capital , a top fintech venture fund. We are looking for a

Machine Learning Engineer for a fully remote position. The candidate will work closely with a team of talented engineers and data scientists to design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models. Your expertise will guide the development of complex algorithms that solve real-world problems, driving efficiency and innovation. As a Machine Learning Engineer with Rain, you will play a central role with our US-based product and engineering teams to implement quickly and contribute to all development lifecycle phases. Our ideal candidate is excited to tackle tough technical challenges and is looking for opportunities to contribute to our strategic thinking. Responsibilities: - Lead the design and implementation of advanced machine-learning algorithms and models - Optimize and enhance existing machine learning frameworks and infrastructure for better scalability and efficiency. - Manage different integration types with 3rd-party vendors and partners - Build reusable code and libraries for future use - Optimize Rain application for maximum speed and scalability - Design and implementation of data storage and data integration solutions - Conduct code reviews, ensuring adherence to best practices and quality standards. Requirements: - Proficient in programming languages such as Python or Java, and experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). - Solid understanding of REST API design, development, and security standards (OAuth). - Experience designing and scaling event-driven microservice architectures, using messaging bus/queue technologies such as Kafka and stream processing. - Management of hosting environment, including database administration and scaling an application to support load changes. - Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes. - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. - Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and best practices. Nice-to-Haves: - Proficient knowledge of back-end programming languages; experience with Go (Golang) - Experience in data pipelines integrating multiple data sources, including data ingestion and transformation. As an equal opportunity employer, Rain is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our people bring our products and organization to life, and every unique perspective makes us better. Title: Data Scientist, Search, Real World Journeys (English, Portuguese)
Description:
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.

Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 3 years of work experience with a PhD degree.
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently to support client relationship management in this region.


Preferred qualifications:


8 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or 6 years of work experience with a PhD degree.


About The Job

In this role, you will work cross-functionally with multiple tech leads from Engineering, Product and UX to advance our metric capabilities. You will apply advanced modeling techniques (e.g., LLM, Gemini models) for ML based metrics, Human Evaluation methods and design research based on user-survey data. Our responsibilities include metric development, product performance investigation, experiment design, and complex user journey analysis.

Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities


Partner with Product and Engineering teams of Real World Journeys to provide problem-solving thought leadership, support metrics research and advanced statistical analysis of complex user journeys on search.
Work cross-functionally to identify metric improvement areas, design new metrics and evaluation methods.
Support teams with advanced experimentation methods, detecting user learning effects and driving actionable user insights from A/B testing metrics analysis.
Work with large data sets and solve non-routine investigative issues, use problem-solving and statistical methods to the issues to measure quality, improve consumer products, and understand the behavior of end-users.
Make product recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders, and storytelling with data.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Scientist/ Engineer (English Speaker- Intern)
Description:
The future of insurance starts with AI. To date, Shift Technology's AI-powered products have benefitted more than 300 million policyholders globally by reducing underwriting risk, identifying more fraud, and automating critical tasks throughout the claims process. Shift harnesses the power of AI to enable the worldâ€™s leading insurance organizations to make better decisions. Our products help insurers improve operational efficiency, reduce costs, and deliver superior customer experiences to their policyholders. Our culture is built on innovation, trust, and a drive to transform the insurance industry by imagining and innovating solutions that impact insurers and their customers - like you! We come from more than 50 different countries and cultures and together we are creating the future of insurance.

The Data Science team works on a broad range of subjects. We actively participate in the definition and development of our suite of products on fraud detection, anti-money laundering and claim automation. We have a lot of technical and professional experience in data science, data engineering, coding, business understanding and client interactions. Additionally, we also work on various data types such as structured data, free text, documents and images.

Please note that to be eligible for this job YOU should be currently enrolled to a SÃ£o Paulo (Capital) University AND be already on the last year of your studies.

What Youâ€™ll Doâ€¦

As a member of the data science team, and working alongside our technical experts, you will be able to:


Understand insurance data and fraud mechanisms;
Create the associated mathematical models;
Implement, test and optimize the associated algorithms;
Participate in workshops with the clients to gather feedback and integrate it into the models;
Continuously provide ideas to improve the solution.



What You Bring...


You are native in Portuguese and fluent in English (mandatory)
You have advanced technical skills in Applied Mathematics, preferably in machine learning and/or operations research;
You combine strong analysis with synthesis abilities and are not afraid to deal with the details;
You can write quality production code;
You are keen to face our clients to discuss their needs and integrate their feedback into your projects;
You can communicate clearly in English and are fluent in another language.



To support our permanent, full time employees at every stage of their careers and lives, we provide a competitive total rewards and benefits package. Here are the global benefits weâ€™d like to highlight:


Flexible remote and hybrid working options
Competitive Salary and a variable component tied to personal and company performance
Company equity
Focus Fridays, a half-day each month to focus on learning and personal growth
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Mental health benefits
2 MAD Days per year (Make A Difference Days for paid volunteering)



Additional benefits may be offered by country - ask your recruiter for more information. Intern and Apprentice position are eligible for some of these benefits - ask your recruiter for more details.

At Shift we strive to be a diverse and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from and hire people who will contribute to the diversity of our company, without regard to race, color, religion, marital status, age, national or ethnic origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other non-merit criteria.

Shift Technology is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our application and employment process. Should you require accommodation, please email accommodation@shift-technology.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

Please be aware of scammers and only trust correspondence that comes from emails ending in shift-technology.com

Shift Technology does not accept unsolicited CVs from recruiters or employment agencies in response to the Shift Technology Careers page or a Shift Technology social media post. Any unsolicited CVs, including those submitted directly to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Shift Technology.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Applied AI
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises â€” including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass â€” use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. Weâ€™re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Engineering at Brex

The Engineering team includes Data, IT, Security, and Software, and is responsible for building innovative products and infrastructure for both internal and external users. We have multiple autonomous and collaborative teams who are eager to learn, teach, and constantly improve how things work. Together, we strive to build robust and scalable systems that enable Brex to grow rapidly and help our customers reach their full potential.

Applied AI at Brex

As part of Brexâ€™s AI team, Applied AI leverages cutting-edge AI/ML techniques to empower automation solutions in Brexâ€™s spend management offering, working closely with Product, Design, and Engineering teams.

What Youâ€™ll Do

The Applied AI team drives for a more streamlined experience for our customers via AI/ML automations. We are looking for a strong Data Scientist to join our nimble and effective team. You will be responsible for the full cycle of work from ideation, research, and development to production and further improvements, working both strategically and tactically with cross-functional stakeholders to balance priority and delivery.

Responsibilities


Design and implement spend management related solutions with ML and AI techniques
Partner closely with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to understand their needs and identify opportunities to accelerate the AI/ML development and deployment process
Consult and educate internal teams on current and up-and-coming research, technologies, and best practices of leveraging ML and LLM in product design and development
Work closely with AI Platform engineers to identify upcoming requirements and continuously evolve the AI platform offering


Requirements


4+ years of industry experience developing optimization models that drive business impact
Passion for delivering data-driven solutions leveraging data, ML, and AI
M.S. or PhD. in Statistics, Computer Science, Math, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, or other quantitative field
Familiarity with programming languages (e.g. Python) and machine learning libraries (e.g. SciKit Learn)
Deep understanding of natural language processing techniques
Experience in overall big data analysis and system-backed integration with ML/LLM system/solution
Good understanding of quantitative disciplines such as statistics, machine learning, operations research, and causal inference
Experience productionizing and A/B testing different machine learning models
English proficiency/fluency, both written and speaking (note: interviews will be conducted in English)
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting September 1st, 2025 when we open our Sao Paulo office


Bonus points


Experience leveraging commercial or open source LLM APIs to build solutions, such as OpenAI or llama
Experience in the finance industry


Location


Must be working in Brazil at the start of role


Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.

Title: Junior Python Developer (Remote From Anywhere)
Description:
At Workling, we're revolutionizing the way businesses thrive by seamlessly matching challenges with skills, igniting instant impact and fueling continuous growth opportunities for professionals worldwide.




Overview of the Role:

We are looking to hire a skilled Junior Python Developer capable of delivering high standards of technical quality and innovation, always striving for continuous improvement, and looking to help all different types of clients around the world.

To ensure success, you must have detailed knowledge of development techniques, excellent communication, and organizational skills.




As part of the team, you will:

- Create automation systems and tools to configure, monitor, and orchestrate data infrastructure and pipelines

- Create data integration services to help onboard new customers as quickly as possible.

- Maintain ongoing reliability, performance, and support of the data infrastructure providing solutions based on application needs and anticipated growth




Key qualifications and skills to succeed in this role:

- 1+ years of practical experience in Python and Django development.

- Experience in development with object-oriented programming is desirable.

- 1 year of development using other programming languages.

- Good skills with XML and relational databases (Oracle / MS SQL / MySQL).

- Strong professional experience working with large data structures (including XML) and algorithms.

- Advanced English level.




What to expect from us:

- Fully Remote: Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere in the world.

- Competitive Compensation: Receive excellent pay in USD or your preferred local currency.

- Home Office Setup: We provide the necessary hardware for your home office.

- Flexible Hours: Design your own work schedule for optimal work-life balance.

- Paid Leave: Enjoy paid parental leave, vacation, and national holidays.

- Dynamic Work Culture: Thrive in our innovative and multicultural environment.

- Elite Collaboration: Work with the global top 1% of talent in various fields.

- Growth and Support: Benefit from mentorship, skill development, promotions, and diverse career growth opportunities




Join Workling's mission to connect top talent with global opportunities, driving impact and sustained growth for professionals and businesses.

If you are looking for a professional challenge that will combine a more sustainable world with top technology join Green:Nexus on this journey.

Title: Sr. Data Scientist - Marketing Analytics
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose â€“ to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

Visa is seeking a team member based in SÃ£o Paulo who will play a pivotal role in developing and implementing campaign measurement methodologies and processes for both client and core Visa LAC marketing campaigns. The role encompasses to measure the impact of these campaigns. The role involves hands-on activities such as the development and execution of campaign measurement methodologies and processes, using either traditional or advanced statistical and automation approaches. It also involves creating documentation, as well as aligning and negotiating with internal stakeholders.

Specific Responsibilities Include


Develop and deploy new analytical modeling and techniques within the organization
Utilize Visa s data and analytic capabilities, technology, and industry expertise measure the impact of different marketing strategies.
Use data and apply statistical techniques to interpret data and generate insights that influence marketing strategy.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing quality control measures
Conceptualize and delivery the standardization of campaign measurement methodology
Develop and implement automated data pipelines to measure campaigns
Foster a data-driven culture within the marketing team and the wider organization.
Connect insights and findings with the business objectives understand business issues, ground into data based insights and ensure application into the execution.
Interact with internal and external stakeholders for the strategic definition of analysis and initiatives.
Incumbents applying for the role must be motivated, data-driven and analytic individuals who will deliver strategic thought leadership, problem solving and high impact solutions to support the business growth and performance. Candidates must have solid experience to develop enduring, strategic relationships across the Visa organization.


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

Basic qualifications


BA/BS required, MBA or other relevant Master degree preferred (eg Statistics, Computer Science, and Engineering).
Preferred qualifications
+5 years of relevant industry experience in in Analytics and CRM, including the full campaign execution cycle, such as Journeys automation, Campaign Datamart structure, Campaign segmentation, result measurement methodologies
5+ years of experience in Banking/ Payment, Retailers or Service industry
Required Skills
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools like Tableau, PowerBI or Excel.
Proven Hands-on experience in advanced analytics and statistical modeling including Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Clustering methods (e.g. K-means), Classification methods (Decision Trees/Random Forest), among others.
Previous experience on studies on consumer behavior, marketing campaign targeting and effectiveness and CLTV
Hands-on experience extracting and manipulating large datasets (Big Data) using standard tools such as Hadoop (Hive), Spark, Python, SQL, etc.
Hands-on skills in cleaning, manipulating, analyzing, visualizing and modeling large data sets
Transform data/ analysis to executive business language
Continuously develop and present innovative ideas based on data driven approach in order to improve current business practices within Visa
Excellent project management and organizational and presentational skills.
Self-motivated, results oriented individual with the ability to handle numerous projects concurrently
Fluency in English/ Spanish (spoken/written), Portugues is a plus


Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Python Backend Developer - Remote
Description:
Location: Latin America/Europe - Permanent Remote

Experience: 6 - 15 Years

Role Type: Contracting Full Time (40 Hrs/week)

Overlap Hours: 8 Hours PST time

Contract Duration: 3-6 Months

Mandatory Skills

Python- 5 years,

Django- 5 years,

SQL-5 years.

Hands-on experience with the AWS cloud is mandatory

Total years of exp- 6+ years experience mandatory

Required Skills


7+ years of experience in software development - ( Purely backend )
Coding experience in server-side programming languages (e.g. Python, Go, Java, Ruby) as well as database languages (SQL)
Experience working with server-side MVC frameworks (e.g. Django, .NET, Spring, Rails, Phoenix)
Past experience and success in building and supporting scalable APIs, services, or applications
Bachelorâ€™s/Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. You are adept at communicating relevant information clearly and concisely.
Deep understanding of customer needs and passion for customer success.
Exhibit core behaviors focused on craftsmanship, continuous improvement, and team success
Ability to look ahead to identify opportunities, foster a culture of innovation, and build for scale.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills


About The Role

A globally recognised firm is seeking a talented and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join their Carriers team! The Carriers team is responsible for developing new features, building infrastructure and maintaining current services. As a Senior Engineer, he/she will provide leadership and oversight in technical design, systems architecture, and coding for their team and the Engineering team.

Responsibility

Design, implement, test, and deploy software services with high SLAs that can handle millions of requests a day.


Ensure scalability and maintainability through microservices adoption, decoupling of concerns from the data model, queuing of jobs, application layering and container-based software distribution.
Continue to build out and enhance our CI/CD pipeline for smooth and safe production releases via automated testing and verification.
Verify and ensure performance and correctness of systems in response time and throughput.
Architect systems and refactor existing systems for optimal performance and reuse
Participate in peer reviews, testing and in design reviews for new features, products, and systems
Collaborate with business teams and provide early input to new product ideas and functionality
Define, implement, and monitor operational metrics to ensure performance and quality.
Work with a sense of urgency and iterate quickly in an agile process.
Mentor more junior engineers on engineering best practices.
Exceptional problem solving skills: demonstrated ability to understand business challenges and translate those into technical solutions.

Title: AI Engineer (Python/C#)
Description:
AI Engineer with Data Science Expertise

Job Description:

Are you a highly skilled and motivated AI Engineer with a strong background in Data Science? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? If so, we want you to join our innovative team! We are seeking an AI Engineer who excels in production-level AI implementation and has hands-on expertise in data clustering, data mining, and feature extraction.

Key Responsibilities:


AI Model Development: Develop and implement cutting-edge Generative AI models within an agentic architecture, utilizing local LLMs, OpenAI fine-tuning, and RAG techniques.
Prompt Engineering: Design and optimize prompts to enhance AI model performance and user interaction.
Data Analysis: Apply data science techniques to extract, cluster, and analyze data, driving continuous AI model improvements.
Embeddings: Work with embeddings to improve the accuracy and relevance of AI models.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with product managers, data scientists, and engineers to understand business requirements and translate them into effective AI solutions.
Continuous Improvement: Monitor and enhance AI models to ensure they meet high performance and accuracy standards.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and data science, incorporating new techniques into our projects.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI models and data science processes.


Requirements:


Educational Background: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Professional Experience: Proven experience in developing and deploying Generative AI models in a production environment.
Technical Proficiency: Strong skills in data clustering, data mining, and feature extraction techniques.
AI Expertise: Experience with local LLMs, OpenAI fine-tuning, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python and C#.
Machine Learning Tools: Experience with frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Communication and Teamwork: Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.


Preferred Qualifications:


Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
MLOps Practices: Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools.
NLP Techniques: Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and applications.
Startup Experience: Prior experience in a startup or fast-paced tech environment.


Join our dynamic team and contribute to the creation of cutting-edge web applications that drive our business forward. Apply now to be a part of an innovative and collaborative work environment!

About Builders:

Builders leverages highly skilled distributed engineering teams with Latin America's top software talent. Connecting top technology startups, mid-size companies and large enterprises across North America with superior tech talent needed to innovate, compete and excel in their field of business.

Title: Data Scientist Internship
Description:
About Translated

Translated is a leading company in AI-enabled translation services. We are on a mission to allow everyone to understand and be understood in their own language.

Our success stems from a unique blend of the worldâ€™s #1 adaptive neural machine translation technology (IDC MarketScape 2022), the largest network of vetted, native-speaking professional translators, and top-ranked AI-enabled text, audio, and video translation tools (Gartner, 2022).

By leveraging a seamless symbiosis of artificial intelligence and human creativity, we design custom localization projects that were previously unthinkable, helping more than 280,000 clients grow their businesses worldwide.

We offer: Data Scientist Internship to join the Translated Data Science and AI Production team in our HQ in Pi Campus, Rome. The candidate will be responsible for building Machine Learning services and analyze company data.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Machine Learning Projects such as Classification Models, Text Categorization
Building and maintaining company-wide KPIs
ETL pipelines
Analyze company data to improve process and KPIs


Qualifications Required


MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics
Experience of Python programming, Machine Learning and Data manipulation libraries
Experience in data wrangling, cleaning, exploration, and feature extraction.
Experience with Relational DBMS ( MySQL, PostgreSQL )
Experience with NoSQL DBMS ( Redis, MongoDB )
Experience with version control GIT and Github workflow
Experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Excellent knowledge of Italian, English and preferably another language.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to rapidly define ideas and solutions, develop critical analyses, and use creative approaches to solve complex problems.


Headquarter

Translated is hosted at Pi Campus, a working environment immersed in nature where 5 luxury villas have been converted into functional offices to foster talent growth. Pi Campus is also a venture firm created by Translated to reinvest part of its profits into promising AI startups.

Benefits and Perks


Gym
Swimming Pool
Kickboxing
Water aerobics
Fitness
Pilates
Table Tennis and Football table
Kitchen and snacks


Learn more about our company: https://translated.com/work-at-translated-onboarding

Diversity statement

At Translated, we proudly embrace and celebrate each individual's unique qualities to our team, regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other differences. We recognize that these diverse perspectives empower us to overcome challenges, foster innovation, and drive excellence. As an inclusive and equal-opportunity employer, we are committed to cultivating an environment where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported to achieve their full potential.

Privacy Policy

Abbiamo una pluriennale esperienza d'ambito maturata presso prestigiosi clienti sui processi e tecnologie di Knowledge Management (KM) ed Enterprise Legal Management (ELM) nei sistemi informativi legali.

Le nostre applicazioni di Legal AI generano conoscenza grazie all'utilizzo di modelli di Statistical/Machine Learning, Deep Learning, con l'obiettivo di aumentare la produttivitÃ , supportare le decisioni strategiche, offrire un valore aggiunto ai processi aziendali interni e semplificare le attivitÃ  di gestione delle pratiche legali.




Per il rafforzamento del team AI, siamo alla ricerca di un Machine learning Engineer che sia parte attiva delle iniziative legate all'intelligenza artificiale all'interno dell'azienda. La risorsa inserita supporterÃ  lâ€™azienda nelle strategie di crescita attraverso lâ€™utilizzo delle moderne tecnologie e Modelli IA per il mercato Legaltech e Regtech.




Descrizione del profilo

La risorsa selezionata deve aver maturato circa 3-4 anni di esperienza e avrÃ  il compito di guidare e supportare il processo di sviluppo di progetti e prodotti innovativi basati sullâ€™utilizzo di metodologie e tecniche data-driven, knowledge intensive e intelligenza artificiale.

AvrÃ  la responsabilitÃ  di preparare e ottimizzare i data set e relativi modelli di analisi in contesti di produzione, seguendo best-practice, metodologie e strumenti di Data mining e AI/MLOps.

LavorerÃ  per la realizzazione di progetti e prodotti contribuendo ad apportare valore aggiunto presso i clienti, utilizzando un approccio sistematico e metodologico per individuare e proporre soluzioni innovative, replicabili e trasferibili.




Requisiti di conoscenza, competenze ed abilitÃ 

Conoscenza delle metodologie di data-mining quali: KDD, CRISP-DM, CRISP-ML(Q), DAMA Bok.
Conoscenza delle architetture e tecnologie big data, data lake e data platform
Conoscenza di modelli e tecniche di apprendimento supervisionato (Classificazione, Regressione, ecc.), non supervisionato (Clustering, Pattern Search, ecc.) e reinforcement learning
Conoscenza di tecniche e strumenti di Ensemble learning e di Resampling methods
Conoscenza di modelli e tecniche di Artificial Neural Networks (ANN) e Deep Learning
Conoscenza ed esperienza con linguaggi, strumenti, librerie e modelli di machine learning e artificial intelligence (ad esempio: SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, MLFlow, KubeFlow, LLAMA2, Mistral, GPT, ecc.)
Supportare il processo di applicazione della data analysis nei progetti di trasformazione digitale presso i Clienti
Ottime capacitÃ  di comunicazione e conoscenza dell'inglese




Percorso formativo

Laurea Magistrale in ambito scientifico (Data Science, Statistica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Informatica, ecc.)
Costituiscono titolo preferenziale: formazione integrativa, partecipazione a master, PhD, percorsi di studi con certificazione su piattaforme MOOC (es. coursera, udemy, ecc.)




Completano il profilo

CapacitÃ  di apprendimento in tempi brevi
Propensione al problem solving

PerchÃ¨ EUforLegal

Crediamo nelle persone e investiamo nella passione, nell' espressione della leadership e del talento. La nostra People Strategy si basa su politiche di inclusione e gender equality, valorizzando ogni forma di individualitÃ  per favorire lâ€™espressione del potenziale e arricchire le competenze di tutti.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Leonardo Ã¨ un gruppo industriale internazionale, tra le principali realtÃ  mondiali nellâ€™Aerospazio, Difesa e Sicurezza che realizza capacitÃ  tecnologiche multidominio in ambito Elicotteri, Velivoli, Aerostrutture, Elettronica, Cyber Security e Spazio. Con oltre 53.000 dipendenti nel mondo, lâ€™azienda ha una solida presenza industriale in Italia, Regno Unito, Polonia, Stati Uniti, e opera in 150 paesi anche attraverso aziende controllate, joint venture e partecipazioni. Protagonista dei principali programmi strategici a livello globale, Ã¨ partner tecnologico e industriale di Governi, amministrazioni della Difesa, Istituzioni e imprese.







Allâ€™interno dellâ€™Area Cyber & Security Solutions, stiamo ricercando un/a Data Scientist per la nostra sede di Roma Laurentina.




La persona si occuperÃ  delle seguenti attivitÃ :

Identificazione dei requisiti software per le soluzioni di AI e deep learning
Progettazione delle soluzioni per l'AI e il deep learning
Analisi delle esigenze degli utenti e le specifiche dei sistemi
Definizione dei requisiti software
Identificazione soluzioni riguardanti l'AI e il deep learning
Sviluppo del relativo software
Gestione delle fasi di sviluppo




Titolo di studio:

Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Statistica, Informatica o altre materie affini al Machine Learning.




Seniority:

Expert. Almeno 3 anni di comprovata esperienza nella attivitÃ  di machine learning, artificial learning e deep learning.




Conoscenze e competenze tecniche:

Conoscenza del Machine Learning e una solida base in statistica per poter analizzare e interpretare dati complessi. Profonda competenza nel Deep Learning, con esperienza pratica nell'implementazione e nell'ottimizzazione di modelli avanzati. Ãˆ essenziale la capacitÃ  di applicare tecniche di Machine Learning e Deep Learning a problemi reali, utilizzando strumenti e framework moderni.




Competenze comportamentali:

ProattivitÃ 
Problem Solving
FlessibilitÃ 




Conoscenze linguistiche:

Conoscenza della lingua inglese di livello almeno B2




Conoscenze Informatiche:

Ottima conoscenza del Machine Learning e buona conoscenza in statistica
Ottima conoscenza del Deep Learning
Ottima conoscenza delle seguenti architetture: Transformers, Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, Decision Trees (XGB, RF)
Ottima conoscenza del linguaggio Python mandatoria
Ottima conoscenza dei framework: Pytorch, Transformers, scikit-learn




Altro

DisponibilitÃ  a trasferte.

Aspettiamo la tua candidatura: inviaci il tuo CV entro tre settimane dallâ€™apertura dellâ€™annuncio di lavoro.




Come funziona il processo di selezione?




A seguito della raccolta delle candidature, vengono valutati e identificati i CV maggiormente in linea con i requisiti richiesti.




Le/i candidate/i selezionate/i sostengono un colloquio conoscitivo con il team delle Risorse Umane, motivazionale e attitudinale, seguito da unâ€™intervista di approfondimento tecnico con il Business.




Al termine del processo, alla persona viene restituito un feedback, sia in caso di esito positivo che negativo.

Title: Junior Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Smart-I S.r.l, a Maggioli group company, is a fresh and dynamic company developing products with Computer Vision and A.I. technology for Smart Cities, Smart Industries, and Smart Retail. We're on the cusp of something that is world-changing and we're looking for someone to join our talented team. This is for a position at our Rome office settled at Tecnopolo Tiburtino.




Your contribution:

As an Artificial Intelligence Junior, you will be in charge of designing and developing the brand-new artificial intelligence algorithms to be hosted on our embedded board as well as on our cloud infrastructure.




[ Some of your responsibilities include ]

Designing & developing machine/deep learning algorithms and edge computing techniques
Design & implementation of computer vision algorithms.
Data analysis & manipulation for training, validation, and testing.




[ Your skills ]




Required

Extensive programming experience in Python
Extensive knowledge of OpenCV and Image Manipulation
Extensive knowledge of TensorFlow/PyTorch libraries
Good in English (written & spoken)
Good knowledge of Linux OS




Preferred

Experience in C++ programming
Experience in multi-core programming and optimization
Experience with AI Accelerators
Experience in code versioning (Git)
Experience in AWS and GCP Environment




[ Education ]

MSc in Computer Science / Artificial Intelligence / Engineering / Robotics




[ Our offer ]

Young and passionate team
Flexible working time and informal working environment
Hybrid working
Challenging and exciting work
Merit-based approach

Title: Sport Data Scientist
Description:
WSF Odds is the first B2B supplier of pre-match and live odds on real performances of football players, providing the most accurate pricing for football players and building high quality products for the sports data industry.




Our core-asset is a fully-automated mathematical and statistical model integrated with machine learning for analyzing data and forecasting future player achievements and actions through a modular and scalable low latency platform that processes thousands of events from the pitch in milliseconds.




We already launched our products for online betting markets and we are currently operating within multiple global markets in partnership with top tier operators.




WSF Odds vision is to expand its products to additional sports and to extend its portfolio with further innovative betting solutions.




WSF Odds is part of Wall Street Football. Wall Street Football vision is to lead the data-centric and tech-centric revolution that will disrupt every aspect of sports and build technologies that valorise sports data in order to connect all sports related services â€“ from media and sport analytics, to fan engagement and sport betting. WSF is operating in several industries through a few controlled or participated companies that work synergically :

WSF Odds (https://www.linkedin.com/company/wsfodds/)
Chiamarsi Bomber (https://www.linkedin.com/company/cb-digital-company-srl/)
Black Duck Ltd




What we are looking for

We are seeking a talented Junior Sport Data Scientist to join our team and help us build and improve our in-house predictive models .

You will collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand product requirements and build predictive models that are accurate, performant, and easily interpretable.

You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the day to day development and maintenance of our existing products in a full Agile environment.




This is a remote working opportunity.




Key Responsibilities

Develop probabilistic models on first tier football data.
Work on highly-granular and extremely varied data sets in order to model complex dynamical processes with advanced analytical methods.
Work in a multi-disciplinary environment with specialists in statistics, machine learning, analytics and engineering.
Work closely with our tech team to make our processes and predictive capabilities as performant and efficient as possible.




Must have:

Masterâ€™s degree/PhD in a quantitative field (Physics / Statistics / Mathematics / Data Science or similar).
Strong background in statistics, probability and mathematics.
Experience with Python and Object-Oriented Programming.
Experience developing predictive models for various use-cases.
Passionate about sports modeling!




Nice to have:

Ability to conduct research autonomously (literature review, experimentation, reporting).
Experience with stochastic processes, Markov-chains and Monte Carlo simulations.
Knowledge of Docker and NoSQL databases (MongoDB).
Previous experience with Java.
Git and version control.
Basic knowledge of betting industry




Why join us

We are an innovative start-up, legally based in Italy, with a team spread around multiple European countries and looking at the global market.

Start-up - Join us from the beginning and partake in its success!
Talented and fun colleagues - People with previous experiences in some of the best companies in the world (Google, Yahoo, Airbnb, etc.)!
Flexible schedule - Work from anywhere, be responsible for your work, no matter where you are or what schedule you are keeping!
Innovative and inspiring environment - We are continually changing, evolving, growing. We embrace innovation and each of your ideas can have a huge impact!
Entertaining and collaborative team - Participate in exciting team experiences and continuously propose new ideas in design brainstorming sessions!
Cutting-edge technologies - Work with latest technologies applied to the most interesting fields: sports and data!




To know more visit: https://wallstreetfootball.io

Title: Artificial Intelligence Space Engineer
Description:
A Joint Venture between Thales (67%) and Leonardo (33%), Thales Alenia Space is a global space manufacturer delivering, for more than 40 years, high-tech solutions for telecommunications, navigation, Earth Observation, environmental management, exploration, science and orbital infrastructures. Thanks to our diversity of skills, talents and cultures, our customers (governments, institutions, space agencies, telecommunications operators), therefore have Space to Connect, Secure & Defend, Observe & Protect, Explore, Travel & Navigate.

Artificial Intelligence Engineering

CANDIDATES THAT WOULD IMPRESS US

PROFILE:

You graduated from an Engineering School with a masterâ€™s degree â€“ a PhD is a plus

Your level of experience ranges from junior to advance: you are a student OR/AND you have already occupied one or more positions among the following: Algorithm or Software Engineer, Artificial Intelligence Engineer

You are curious and willing to stay abreast of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

You enjoy thinking "outside the box" and use your creativity to address complex challenges

You are recognised as a team player and promote collaborative work

You are user centric and want to design components accordingly

COMPETENCIES:

You have in-depth knowledge in mathematics, algorithms, experiment plan, continuous iterations and Agility

You are proficient in one of the following Artificial Intelligence Approches:

Data driven AI, Symbolic AI, Hybrid AI on the Solution

Symbolic Artificial Intelligence and reasoning

Human/machine dialog

Systems Analysis

You understand the norms, laws and standards

You have knowledge of cybersecurity

You can confidently discuss with people from different jobs and background

You master foundational concepts in mathematics/ statistics science and their application to deploy them on Solution studies: statistical modelling, linear algebra, optimisation, machine learning Mathematics and Statistics

NICE TO HAVE:


Working heritage on major satellite Earth Observation and Navigation systems
Simulation by tool such as Matlab & Simulink
adopting modern Agile and DevOps processes
Knowledge of Data analysis and big data technologies
Knowledge of Cloud technologies and architectures
Knowledge of Edgetechnologies
Knowledge of object programming in particular Python (Pyorch) , Java, C ++ and relevant Data Science packages (such as numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas...);
Good knowledge of operating systems;



LIFE AS A THALES ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ENGINEERING ROLE

As an Artificial Intelligence Engineering Role within Thales, you will:

Design and develop trustworthy artificial intelligence components for various domains

Identify the right cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence technologies (machine learning, symbolic AI, dialogue) and develop the Artificial Intelligence component accordingly

Work on Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Understanding (NLU), and also to design multimodal approaches for Human-Machin Dialog including intention understanding, reasoning and hybrid AI

Work on Machine Learning, causality vs. correlation, and/or other Data driven AI technics such as Random Forest, Evolutionary Algorithms, â€¦

Work on Symbolic AI, Ontology, Semantic Web, Knowledge based Reasoning, Meta-heuristics, Problem Solving, Operations Research, Decision Making and reasoning

Propose and design approach alternatives

Integrate scientific method into engineering system methodology

Ensure data knowledge and traceability

Ensure continuous technowatch and be aware of the latest trends (technical, philosophical, ethical by design)

Define the system capabilities thanks to a functional, logical and value analysis, describing functions to be performed to meet the real needs of the user in the various scenarii and maximising product value for Customer

YOUR CAREER AT THALES

Future opportunities will allow you to discover other domains or sites. You will be able to evolve and grow your competences in different areas:

Room and attention to personal development

Build your talents in another domain of Thales Group, discovering new products, new customers, new country or go to a more complex Solution

Choose between a technical expertise or a leadership path

Build an international career within a leading Engineering Group

At Thales Alenia Space we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales Alenia Space employing around 8,900 employees in 10 countries with 17 sites in Europe and a plant in the US, our mobility policy enables employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad. Thales Alenia Space sees space as a new horizon, helping to build a better, more sustainable life on Earth #SpaceForLife. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
HTML:
Siamo unâ€™Azienda italiana attiva in ambito Data & Artificial Intelligence.

Il Gruppo dispone di tecnologie proprietarie, soluzioni e servizi che concretizzano il potenziale dellâ€™AI e dei dati nellâ€™evoluzione digitale di Aziende e Pubbliche Amministrazioni e puÃ² contare su oltre 300 clienti nazionali ed internazionali, in settori quali Government, Finance, Energy & Utilities, Turismo, Healthcare, operando direttamente e tramite partner.

Oltre 400 professionisti e laboratori tecnologici AI dedicati allo sviluppo di prodotti, piattaforme e soluzioni verticali destinate ai diversi comparti di mercato.

Posizione:

Avrai l'opportunitÃ  di entrare a far parte dei Laboratori di Ricerca e Sviluppo Cognitive & AI di Almawave, allâ€™interno della Direzione Technology & Innovation, in un ambiente fortemente stimolante ed eterogeneo, costantemente impegnato nello sviluppo di prodotti innovativi di AI.

Che ruolo ricoprirai?

Nel ruolo di AI Engineer collaborerai con il team di Ingegneria dei prodotti per l'industrializzazione di tecnologie e modelli in ambito AI e NLP, realizzando soluzioni all'interno dei prodotti e della piattaforma AIWave di Almawave.

ResponsabilitÃ  ed attivitÃ :

  • AttivitÃ  di sperimentazione, sviluppo e miglioramento continuo di tecnologie e modelli in ambito AI e NLP, sfruttando e combinando diverse tecniche stato dell'arte (LLM, RL, DL, KG), per la realizzazione di prodotti in grado di raggiungere i piÃ¹ sfidanti obiettivi nei campi di Conversational AI, Information Retrieval e Knowledge Representation;
  • Ruolo cruciale per la creazione e sperimentazione di soluzioni innovative come, ad esempio, il fine tuning di modelli LLM o l'ibridazione con knowledge graph e dati strutturati.


Requisiti:

  • Laurea Magistrale/Dottorato in Ingegneria Informatica o discipline equivalenti;
  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza in posizioni simili;
  • Solido background ed esperienza in Machine Learning, Deep Learning e NLP con un focus su Generative AI e LLM;
  • Solida esperienza di programmazione in Python e conoscenza delle principali librerie e framework di ML/NLP: Pytorch, TensorFlow, Huggingface;
  • Competenze e conoscenze di metodologie e tecnologie di utilizzo di LLM (LangChain, HayStack, LLamaIndex, ecc.) e di prompt engineering avanzato (Chain-of-Thought, Graph Prompting..) o di tecniche di automatic prompt tuning;
  • Competenze di metodologie e approcci in almeno uno tra: Information Retrieval, Conversational AI e Knowledge Graph;
  • Esperienza nel deploy di modelli di machine learning in produzione;
  • Esperienza nella gestione di dataset di grandi dimensioni;
  • Forte attitudine al problem solving e autonomia nel lavoro;
  • Conoscenza delle normative e tematiche di Ethical AI;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Competenze gradite:

  • Competenza di programmazione in linguaggi aggiuntivi a Python (Java, Go e JavaScript/TypeScript);
  • Conoscenza di strumenti e metodologie agile in ambienti con cultura AI/Ops â€“ Dev/Ops;
  • Esperienza in algoritmi di parameter-efficient fine-tuning (PEFT) per LLM e/o in tecniche di efficient training/serving;
  • Conoscenza di tecniche e algoritmi di XAI;
  • Pubblicazioni in conferenze e riviste dell'area.

Title: ML Engineer Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, Ã¨ tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con piÃ¹ di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicitÃ , talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, lâ€™ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra prioritÃ . Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunitÃ  e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Machine Learning Engineer in NTT DATA will have a solid Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise GenAI architecture and MLops), mathematical background, experience working on a range of classification, informational retrieval, clustering, and optimization problems, establishing scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analysis, model development, model validation and model implementation.

The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will work alongside experienced Data Scientists, Data and ML Engineers to identify business opportunities, design and create new data pipelines from scratch, from experiments to deploying them in production.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the ML Engineers and connecting with the stakeholders.

Required Skills

  • At least 5 years of production experience working in Data Science or Software Engineering;
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms;
  • At least 6/12 months of experience in Generative AI deployment and underlying architecture handling;
  • Vector Database knowledge is well appreciated;
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture;
  • Fluent in a at least two mainstream programming language (Python, Scala, Java, C++);
  • Experience in building an infrastructure for technical users, such as Data Scientist, ML practitioners or data consumers/producers;
  • Strong knowledge of Spark, Databricks is a strong plus;
  • Experience developing/deploying ML solutions in one of the public cloud platforms and on a Cross-cloud base, Snowflake knowledge is a plus;
  • Deep knowledge with machine learning frameworks (such as Keras or PyTorch);
  • Ability to design and implement machine learning pipelines in a production environment;
  • Experience with deployment including knowledge of CI/CD, containerization, and related concepts with a focus over MLops/Re-Training/Drift Management;
  • Ability to train more junior team members in multiple Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Pisa, Roma, Torino

Title: Data Scientist Senior
HTML:
NTT DATA, Trusted Global Innovator, Ã¨ tra i principali player a livello mondiale in ambito IT services. Con piÃ¹ di 140.000 professionisti in oltre 50 Paesi in tutto il mondo, siamo protagonisti e acceleratori della trasformazione digitale offrendo ai nostri clienti soluzioni tecnologiche e innovative progettate su misura. Il motore di NTTDATA sono le persone, ognuna con la propria unicitÃ , talento ed attitudine. Abbiamo costruito una Smile Working Company in cui la cura, lâ€™ascolto delle persone, il loro benessere e sviluppo delle competenze sono la nostra prioritÃ . Abbiamo creato spazi di lavoro che favoriscono il senso di comunitÃ  e lo scambio costruttivo di esperienze.

Guardiamo al nostro domani con la stessa passione di ieri e abbiamo bisogno anche del tuo talento!

www.nttdata.com/it

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate as Senior Data Scientist in NTT DATA will have a mix of skills including Generative AI hands-on capability (preferably on Azure/GCP and on-premise) engineering best practices, statistical expertise, Machine and Deep Learning skills and a strong business sense.

The Senior Data Scientist will work with fellow data scientists, data engineers, ML Engineers, product managers, business analysts, and stakeholders from other internal groups and from external clients.

He/She will be responsible for multiple projects, leading the Data Scientists and connecting with the stakeholders on client?s side, to ensure that tasks are on time and well executed.

Required Skills

  • Experience of at least 3-5 years as data scientist;
  • Strong Python (mandatory) and SQL coding;
  • Knowledge of Java/Scala or C++/R is a plus;
  • Tensorflow and Pytorch knowledge with a focus over Computer Vision solutions;
  • Knowledge of ML solutions architecture and Generative AI pipelines;
  • Cloud and hybrid ML implementations;
  • Incorporate new, cutting edge business intelligence, machine learning, and alternative data practices into wider organization to drive efficiencies and generate revenue;
  • Own the full stack execution of data science projects from data wrangling, model development, presentation, measurement to deployment;
  • Work with data engineers to produce fully productionized pipelines including data ingestion, cleaning, feature engineering and model training/prediction;
  • Conduct research and analysis into reinsurance and advisory products to augment industry-standard models and develop new market offerings;
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal team members and external clients


Location: Milano, Bari, Bologna, Cosenza, Napoli, Roma, Salerno, Torino

Title: Construction Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

JOB DESCRIPTION

At Technip Energies, we believe in a better tomorrow, and we believe we can make tomorrow better. With approximately 15,000 talented women and men, we are a global and leading engineering and technology company, with a clear vision to accelerate the energy transition. Designing and delivering added value energy solutions is what we do. If you share our determination to drive the transition to a low-carbon future, then this could be the job for you. We are currently seeking a Construction Data Scientist, reporting directly to the Global Construction Data Innovation Manager in Rome to join our Construction Data Science team based in Paris (France) and Rome (Italy).

About The Job

The Global Construction Data Innovation (GCDI) is part of Global Construction, within Delivery Excellence division, and aims to develop and improve digital solutions, data science solutions (data analytics and AI), data accessibility and bi reporting for better estimating, preparing & controlling construction activities with the target to optimize construction resources, costs & duration.

The Construction Data Scientist will be part of the Construction Data Science team.

He/She will have mathematical and statistical expertise, along with natural curiosity and a creative mind. While mining and interpreting, and cleaning T.EN data, this person will be relied on to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover hidden opportunities for realizing the dataâ€™s full potential.

He/She will support projects all around the globe to use their data as best as possible to create value and improve the management at site.

He/She will work on data produced from past construction projects for identifying benchmarking and construction patterns to optimize construction execution.

He/She will produce digital solutions to make construction management taking data driven decisions.

He/She will be at the interface between site teams, CMC teams, Data Office teams and IDS teams.

He/She will be part of the CMC team and will strive to continuously improve the performance of construction at site.

Construction Data Scientist will be performing the following task:


Enable smarter business processes by using analytics for meaningful insights to help solve problems across various domains and industries.
Analyze data to identify patterns and trends to deliver recommendations for the future.
Visualization: develop data visualization and storytelling solutions.
Business Understanding: collaborate with businesses to understand their needs and identify use cases to develop.
IT understanding: collaborate with IT and Data Office for understanding the data frame where develop, deploy, and run digital and data science products.
Data Understanding: analyze data for exploring data characteristics and their alignment with business use case.
Data Preparation: interact with Data Engineering to set up the data sources and all steps of dataset preparation.
Modelling & Validation: develop modelling methodology, features engineering, implement model, follow up model training and its validation, and definition of efficient model to deploy.
Monitoring: monitoring and fine tuning of the model developed
Deployment: interact with IT and Data Office for deployment and industrialization of data science and digital solutions developed
Communicate findings to all stakeholders.
Prepare and deliver documentation, training and webinar about data science.
Staying up to date with the latest advancements in AI and scripting language.



We offer you not only a job, but an inspiring journey in a truly global environment where you team up to break down boundaries thanks to the innovation, creativity and pioneer spirit which drive our people.

About You

Weâ€™d love to hear from you if your profile meets the following essential requirements:

Qualifications:


Masterâ€™s degree in Engineering (preference for IT and mechanical engineering), or Computer Science or Mathematical



Languages: English fluent

Main Skills:


Analytical thinking for translating data into descriptive, predictive and prescriptive analytics and products.
Story telling mindset.
Very good communication skills to identify the business requirements and to expose findings to all stakeholders.
Able to interface with IT and Data Office for understanding the data framework of data science projects.
Able to associate more efficient Machine Learning models to a specific business use case.
Able to identify algorithm metrics and monitoring system.
Data science curious, open mind and updated to data science state of art.
Ability to think creatively and strategically with excellent problem-solving skills..
Able to manage more than one activity at the same time.
Attitude to perform the work in team, in an international and multi-cultural environment.
Ability to fulfil tasks on time with the required Company quality level
Able to work and deliver in an incremental approach
Availability to international mobility either for short- or long-term assignment



Technical Competencies:


Knowledge of data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis
Knowledge of SQL (from a data scientist perspective, not necessarily dev or data engineering)
Knowledge of Scripting Language (e.g., Python, R, Julia) and data science libraries
Knowledge of main Machine Learning models (supervised and unsupervised)
Knowledge of data pipelines, cleansing and data preparation
Knowledge of Statistical computing package (e.g, R) is a plus
Knowledge of NLP, LLM is a plus
Knowledge of Agile, Git, DevOps and MLOps is a plus
Knowledge of BI and visualization tools (e.g, PowerBI) is a plus
Knowledge of Dataiku and Synapse are a plus



Knowledge of Construction work processes is a plus

Inclusion Standards

In our continuous journey to developing and building culture of inclusion, we adhere to four Inclusion Gold Standards. And you?


We challenge our biases and embrace diversity of thought ;
No one has all the knowledge and solutions, collectively we do ;
We foster a caring environment where people are respected, comfortable to share and be heard ;
We promote active listening for effective decision and action.



Whatâ€™s Next?

Starting Date:

Once receiving your system application, Recruiting Team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe. Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application.

Forecast Starting Date: Asap by 2024

Position located to: Rome OC, Italy

We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.technipenergies.com and follow us on LinkedIn , Instagram , Facebook , Twitter , Youtube for company updates.
